film.summary: After witnessing a mysterious train crash, a group of friends in the summer of 1979 begin noticing strange happenings going around in their small town, and begin to investigate into the creepy phenomenon.
A terrible accident transforms best friends from high school Zach and Josh into enemies. This ambitious thriller is set in the American suburbs of the early 1990s - the pre-Columbine era. (IFFR)
film.quote: It doesn't really go out of its way to do anything new from a narrative perspective, but it's all executed good enough that it's much better than mediocre. I chalk this up to the way it's shot; the town looks menacing and not quite right, whether it's the shit that goes on around the main characters (which is never returned to), or the emphasis the director/cinematographer put on the environment. Trees seem evil here (which they are, fuck trees and their ulterior motives).

film.summary: Liam&#039;s Mom, Jean is in prison...but is due to be released in time for his 16th birthday. This time Liam is determined that things will be different. He dreams of a family life he&#039;s never had, which means creating a safe haven beyond the reach of wasters like Jean&#039;s boyfriend Stan and his own mean-spirited grandfather. (Lions Gate Films)
film.quote: Like QVT, I needed subtitles, haha. I felt like such a loser, nice to know I'm not alone. Cheers Sweet Sixteen Subtitle Buddy. This didn't grab me emotionally like, say, This is England did, but this was a good movie and I can't fault it so much.

film.summary: A small group of former classmates organize an elaborate, annual game of tag that requires some to travel all over the country.
film.quote: It's not a real funny comedy, which I guess sounds like a failure, but it does have some good jokes and some of these people have good chemistry and are just charming outright. But I enjoyed it because it had heart and this premise is awesome. It warms my heart that there are grown men out there who are doing/did this, and I think that comes out wonderfully in this flick. The ending is also emotional, funny and joyful without being ridiculous.

film.summary: Ted and John are back for another adventure.
film.quote: Not as good as the first but still has some huge laughs. Comic-Con section dragged with little pay-off, but the rest of it was gleefully offensive and humorous. Liam Neeson is the star there; his segment was fantastic.

film.filmname: Tell Spring Not To Come This Year (2015)
film.summary: The war in Afghanistan, through the eyes of the Afghans who live it. (imdb)
film.quote: This is a chilling documentary with a great premise. Anybody interested in hearing opposing stories of war should seek it out immediately, if possible.

film.summary: A documentary that exposes what corporations and governments learn about people through Internet and cell phone usage, and what can be done about it ... if anything.
film.quote: Any documentaries like this are important viewing because this really does affect everyone in this day and age. We're all guilty of simply agreeing. I knew a lot of this information anyway, but it's still a horror flick, essentially. It's really dry, and maybe a bit uncreative in how it presents its info, but it's still interesting and terrifying information to be presented with.

film.summary: A coming-of-age story that follows 12-year-old Andy Nichol (Chase Ellison), a bright student who, like most kids his age, will do anything to avoid conflict for fear of suffering overwhelming ridicule and punishment from his junior high school peers. Everyone's favorite teacher, Mr. Simon (Ed Harris), pairs Andy with the school's biggest outcast and social pariah, Stanley, aka &quot;Big G&quot; (Alexander Walters) on a critical term project. (imdb)
film.quote: It does a good job of doing what coming-of-age stories are meant to do. I like that even though Stanley isn't the main character, the movie kind of revolves around him, in a sense. I thought it was an emotional movie, tackling the irrational fear of homosexuality, the importance of teachers, and of course, kids growing up. I didn't find it overly funny so it's more of a drama to me than a comedy. I guess since it's classified as a comedy, that's a bit of a fail, but fuck it.

film.filmname: This Film Is Not Yet Rated (2006)
film.summary: Kirby Dick's exposé about the American movie ratings board. (imdb)

Faced with an enemy that even Odin and Asgard cannot withstand, Thor must embark on his most perilous and personal journey yet, one that will reunite him with Jane Foster and force him to sacrifice everything to save us all. (imdb)
film.quote: I was going to rate this a 70 but I rated the first one a 70 and I liked this one more I think. The first little while wasn't great but once Loki got unleashed the entire movie just got better, partially because of him but partially because I just felt everything else got more entertaining and amusing. There's some decent action here, decent acting, decent everything. It's just another comic book movie but those are okay once in a while. I'm not a big Thor fan though.

film.summary: Two teenage girls in suburban Connecticut rekindle their unlikely friendship after years of growing apart. In the process, they learn that neither is what she seems to be, and that a murder might solve both of their problems. (imdb)
film.quote: It has an oppressive atmosphere and both leads do well with what they are given. The direction is great: a Hitchcockian sense of tension and suspense, solid usage of lighting and sound (seriously cool soundtrack) to build the mood. It even made me laugh a few times. And yet despite all the fantastic elements I did not love it. Technically efficient in all regards except its inability to make me care for them. At first I thought it was an interesting relationship but it lost me a bit.

film.summary: Jimmy Arnaud eulogizes his mother (imdb)
film.quote: As we watch this man mourn the loss of his mother in a single take, Thunder Road hits a couple spots: it's emotional but slightly awkwardly amusing. It's emotional because it's honest -- it tackles the idea of loss and how important parents are. We also get to learn a fair bit about this guy in a short period of time due to his monologue. I didn't find it that funny but I can see that some of it is played for laughs. It didn't wow me but I dug it a fair bit.

film.summary: A former L.A. drug dealer (Thomas Jane) has moved to Houston to make a new life for himself as a married architect... (imdb)
film.quote: The movie that got me into Eckhart and he does a great job. It's a fairly clever, crime thriller that allows you to get close to it. You can feel for the characters (there was a part or two that made me tear up... then again I'm a wussy too). More than enough to recommend here.

film.summary: At Fort Polk, Louisiana, thousands of young men prepare for Vietnam. The specter of combat hangs over the men of A-Company, Second Platoon, as they enter the final stage of infantry training. They will be sent to the war. But each man deals with this prospect in his own way. One man&#039;s defiance, however, galvanizes every member of the platoon. (20th Century Fox)
film.quote: It focuses on going to 'Nam, but you never see them in actual combat. It's more a drama set in war times. It's not real original or anything but it asks some good questions and it's gritty and very well made. Great movie. Schumacher can actually make good films, who knew!

film.summary: Dawn, a middle aged woman who lives alone in a small town in Montana spends her days working as a maid at a roadside motel and scrounging through junk she purchases at local storage auctions hoping to one day 'hit the jackpot' and fund her travels and her escape from the town. Her humdrum life is slowly upended as Paul, a ramblin' man from her past, rolls like a tumbleweed through her small town. (imdb)
film.quote: It has some flaws, most notably the poetry over the lush imagery (you'll know what I mean when you see it) and sometimes it lingers too much on one moment, but Britni West is a talented director and this is a great debut. It's usually beautiful, reminds me a tiny bit of a less challenging, avant-garde and provocative Gummo (my fave movie) and due to the way its filmed, it looks a little retro and the grainy visuals make it seem like a documentary.

film.summary: Atticus Finch, a lawyer in the Depression-era South, defends a black man against an undeserved rape charge and his kids against prejudice. (imdb)

Bound by a shared destiny, a bright, optimistic teen bursting with scientific curiosity and a former boy-genius inventor jaded by disillusionment embark on a danger-filled mission to unearth the secrets of an enigmatic place somewhere in time and space that exists in their collective memory as "Tomorrowland." (imdb)
film.quote: A great, but flawed, film. It's very imaginative, which makes sense because it keeps talking about imagination and whatnot, with wonderful visuals and a realized world which would have been more compelling had we seen even more. Good performances all around, some really funny parts, good action, excellent direction Bird. I'm okay with preachy but this didn't need it; the film had been poking us with its themes throughout and the exposition dump slowed the pace down.

film.filmname: Trailer Park Boys: Countdown to Liquor Day (2009)
film.summary: Ricky, Julian and Bubbles are released from jail again to find that the Sunnyvale Trailer park has moved along with all the residents and Bubbles' kitties have been taken to the SPCA.
film.quote: Yeah I'm on with TheRealJ-Ro about this. There are some gratifying moments and they're still the same characters you know and love but Bubbles, guys and girls, is not THAT funny. He's funny (they all are) but he's not lead material. The movie's funny, it has some genuinely touching moments but it does suffer from not being as, er, raw as most of the rest of Trailer Park Boys. The ending was a cop out and this movie was not the classic (for NSers, y'know) that it should have been.

film.summary: An art auctioneer who has become mixed up with a group of criminals partners with a hypnotherapist in order to recover a lost painting. (imdb)
film.quote: At first I wasn't feelin' it, but as it went on it sucked me into its plot. I don't feel like it was the most tightly written movie I've ever seen by any means but it's well put together with good performances. By the end of it all, it has mind fucked you a bit, but not overly so.

film.summary: Five years ago David's life came undone when his young daughter fell victim to a brutal attack. The subsequent emotional fallout cost him his marriage and his job. Handicapped by guilt and anguish David abandoned his past and alienated himself. He took a second rate job as a security guard and plodded on - his wounds concealed but unhealed. All it would take is a scratch for them to open wide and consume him... (imdb)
film.quote: A nice revenge flick, nothing more, nothing less. What you will get is a guy having a reason to get back at people... and he goes out and does it. It's not real violent until the end, so most of the movie is a build-up. I'm a big fan of the ending though, instead of a happy ending the movie shows just how useless his attempts were.

film.summary: The story centers around a family with three boys in the 1950s. The eldest son witnesses the loss of innocence. (imdb)
film.quote: There are amazing scenes in here. But then the rest of the movie is kind of okay, nothing terribly special. Not quite boring, but not real interesting. When he embraced the surrealism I was more intrigued because the movie didn't hit me on an emotional level. For a movie that tries to be so beautiful (and it succeeds at times, most definitely), I didn't get that feeling of a masterpiece. I did for the first half hour or so though. This was on its way to a 90.

film.summary: When a woodsman goes for some trees, strange things start to happen... (archive.org)
film.quote: A nice little humorous short about a lumberjack and trees that keep getting squished by a bunny with evil looking eyes who reminds me a bit of the fucking cat in Jabberwocky, but not as cool. This is a nice way to spend a little less than 10 minutes.

film.summary: Tropico is a spin on stories from the bible, starring Lana Del Rey as Eve. It takes you through a few different times and environments.
film.quote: I enjoyed it, partially because of the music. I'm a big fan of her music, but I haven't been as much of a fan of her videos because I think a bunch of them have just ended up being silly instead of artsy. But this was a nice balance, a little trippy, and even a little emotional. It was dreamy but gritty at times and the acting was believable (especially considering the director says that they didn't know about the robbery).

film.summary: A teenage girl is targeted by an online sexual predator.
film.quote: So far I've watched two movies this year about sexual predators (Megan Is Missing as well). If I keep this up, the FBI will get the wrong idea. But in all seriousness... like someone else, the onscreen chatting text was lame as hell. Luckily, the rest of the movie is completely solid. Emotional, it looks at something that can't be looked at enough, and it all comes together well.

film.summary: In a drab, anonymous gray school governed by a strict authoritarian regime, an apparently unremarkable day is turned on its head following a seemingly ridiculous announcement. Disbelieving at first, the all male, identically uniformed pupils are informed that what they had always been taught as fact is no longer true.
film.quote: Simple concept, but done well. Very Orwellian (to the point that it also uses 2+2=5), but that's not bad because this kind of thing still rings true. I wasn't amazed by it despite thinking it was effective, but I will say that offing a kid like that is pretty ballsy considering so many filmmakers are discouraged from doing that.

film.summary: Sometimes first love is found in the most unlikely of places, like in the carpark outside the Te Kaha pub. (imdb plot summary)
film.quote: I like the gay little boy in the car. Wait, that sounds wrong... HE WAS FUNNY OKAY? He only said like "Yup" and "I'm trying to read" but I liked him. Anyway this is a charming little short, good stuff from the kids.

film.summary: Scarlett Johannson stars as a voracious alien seductress who scours remote highways and backroads for human prey. (tiff.net)
film.quote: Possibly an 85. There are some really dull moments, but for the most part it's a pretty terrifying and suspenseful flick. The soundtrack is the biggest reason why, as it is just straight up creepy. The imagery is interesting and Johannson does give a good performance as an alien who apparently is figuring out what it's like to be human. I think. It's a cold but mostly affective movie.

film.summary: Until the Light Takes Us is a feature length documentary chronicling the history, ideology and aesthetic of Norwegian black metal - a musical subculture infamous as much for a series of murders and church arsons as it is for its unique musical and visual aesthetics.
film.quote: I disagree with people who say there's no point. From it, one can learn that there's an opposing voice in Norway that gets misunderstood, media twists shit the way they want, and one can learn things about black metal they might not have known. It has a good mixture of ambient music and black metal. It's not perfect by any means, but it has a certain aesthetic, a visual and emotional sense, that is true to the scene and is just interesting on its own. Pretty good for a pointless film.

film.summary: When a massive power outage plunges the city of Detroit into total darkness, a disparate group of individuals find themselves alone. Soon the daylight begins to disappear completely, and as the survivors gather in an abandoned tavern, they realize the darkness is out to get them, and only their rapidly diminishing light sources can keep them safe.
film.quote: I'm just not behind the hate on this one. First of all, the movie plays perfectly on a very common fear of the dark, and makes a creepy thriller with only two big jump scares, which are made more amazing due to the fact there aren't 80 of them. I think, even though most of the movie is pretty dark, that there are actually some good images (like when the shadow people show up, for example). I also like that nothing is explained. I like just watching people survive. The acting was serviceable.

film.summary: Years after walking away from her past as a teenage private eye, Veronica Mars gets pulled back to her hometown - just in time for her high school reunion - in order to help her old flame Logan Echolls, who's embroiled in a murder mystery.
film.quote: I'm not a massive fan of the series, but have a certain affection for the characters so I went in reasonably excited. I wasn't disappointed. It's a compelling murder mystery with Bell delivering clever and witty retorts to just about everyone... just like the TV show. Maybe it doesn't feel as big as a movie should, but it's a damn good episode, if nothing else. It's not a movie for people unfamiliar with the show, but that should be obvious.

film.summary: A documentary about one of Britain's most dangerous crime families and introduces us to its magnetic, larger-than-life leader, Dominic Noonan (aka Lattlay Fottfoy).
film.quote: It's a subject I know very little about so that works in its favor. I feel like it could have gone into a little more detail but I suppose you can't say everything.

film.summary: A soldier returning from the war in Afghanistan uncovers a conspiracy involving the intelligence services and a gang of drug dealers. (imdb)
film.quote: I'm not really with the bad reviews here. Most of the movie builds, and I feel tries to say a little something, and then I really liked the last 15-20 minutes or whatever. I thought it was extremely well done. I enjoyed it, solid performances, decent script. There are flaws, and this won't be one of the best movies of the year but I did really like it. Sometimes the plot didn't move in the most coherent way, yes, but mostly it was good.

film.summary: A single mother finds that things in her family's life go very wrong after her two young children visit their grandparents. (imdb)
film.quote: I dug it. It's a mess tonally, and sometimes it feels like M. Night is slipping into bad habits, but then some of the writing is some of the most clever stuff he has done since Unbreakable. He's still a talented director, and this is funnier than it is scary. The horror lacks a little, and is sometimes silly, but I laughed a bunch of times.

film.summary: Manny, Joel, and Jonah tear their way through childhood and push against the volatile love of their parents. As Manny and Joel grow into versions of their father and Ma dreams of escape, Jonah embraces an imagined world all on his own. (imdb)
film.quote: The intimacy and rawness of the way it was shot made it feel a bit like a documentary. There's a plot there, technically, but it's more slice of life than conventional story. It takes a little while to get going and still occasionally lost my interest. But the parts that are good are really good, and it elevates itself in the last half hour or so. You have to enjoy watching the characters interact and it did feel organic and genuine. Intercutting with drawings periodically was a nice touch.

film.summary: Umay is a young woman of Turkish descent, fighting for an independent and self-determined life in Germany against the resistance of her family. Her struggle initiates a dynamic, which results in a life-threatening situation. (imdb)
film.quote: "Oh FUCK" at the ending, and the lovely piano music during the credits adds a real sense of importance. In fact, the music is good the whole time. I feel like some of the flow of the movie was wonky but great performances all around. Umay is a really compelling character. As someone on IMDB said, "a hero in the best sense of the word." Also: a great, realistic world about human rights and family. It's sickening watching some of these people, but then you know it's very true.

film.summary: Chris, an elderly Alzheimer's sufferer, is confined to his home. His son, Michael, is his primary caregiver. For months Chris' mind has been fading away and with it his grasp on reality. He is desperately trying to hold onto his mind. Chris is passing further and further from recognition. Michael is left wracked by survivors guilt. But to Chris, the world around him has become nothing more than a waking dream... (imdb)
film.quote: Let's get the bad out of the way. The guy who played the son was bad, the sound editing was wonky at times, and some of the writing was too blunt, especially at the beginning. When you get past that though, there's an incredibly touching movie here as we watch this old man struggle. It is bound to pull on your heart strings, and the last line (before the part in the credits) is very sad. Spoiler: "Can you show it to me again?" Ends up being a very sad movie despite its flaws.

film.summary: Whose Streets? is an unflinching look at how the killing of 18-year-old Mike Brown inspired a community to fight back and sparked a global movement. (imdb)
film.quote: If you want a doc that goes into both sides of the argument you aren't going to get it here. This is BLM perspective. The tale of Brown has been told, but regardless of where you fall on it, this is still interesting but not mind-blowing. The footage is great, the detail that it puts into framing the protests is probably the best part. This sounds snotty but most people/media outlets don't really "get" protests. Even if the Brown death was a mess, this still brings up valid issues.

film.summary: An FBI agent teams with the town's veteran game tracker to investigate a murder that occurred on a Native American reservation. (imdb)
film.quote: Completely solid writing again from Sheridan, who is quietly becoming one of the better writers in the industry in my eyes. Slow but not boring, violence worked when it had to. Has something to say and while I think that sometimes gets lost, it does stick to its themes well. I don't think it's substantial because a better director would bring the writing to life more (like in Sicario), but it's a good directorial debut for sure with a great sense for atmosphere and understanding of the Western.

film.summary: New England, 1630: William and Katherine lead a devout Christian life, homesteading on the edge of an impassible wilderness, with five children. When their newborn son mysteriously vanishes and their crops fail, the family begins to turn on one another. 'The Witch' is a chilling portrait of a family unraveling within their own fears and anxieties, leaving them prey for an inescapable evil. (imdb)
film.quote: I thought I'd love it but I only liked it. You can't fault the foreboding atmosphere and the cinematography, along with the wonderful performances. The dialogue is hard to understand at times, but there was a lot of research here. My issue is that for as creepy as it is--not allowing us to feel any sanctuary from the tone--it doesn't have enough moments in it that impacted me. There were a couple, but I wasn't terrified (and I thought I would be). Works more as a drama than a horror.

film.summary: Based on the New York Times bestseller, WONDER tells the incredibly inspiring and heartwarming story of August Pullman, a boy with facial differences who enters fifth grade, attending a mainstream elementary school for the first time. (imdb)
film.quote: A movie like this is built to manipulate, but unlike an egregious example of that in something like the Judge, this works. It got to me. It's a positive message that has some drama but doesn't lose focus on its message of kindness... movies like this need to exist. There are some hokey parts--the flashback with grandma is astonishingly bad--but the movie is effective with good performances and a little more depth than one might expect since it digs a little deeper into the lives these people.

film.filmname: Yakuza Apocalypse: The Great War of the Underworld (2015)
film.summary: Yakuza vampires battle it out to avenge the death of their boss at the hands of an international syndicate.
film.quote: While FrankHowley is right in the sense it doesn't have a lot of heart, I feel it covers it up by just being batshit crazy. And that's appealing to me, to have such an energetic film. It's not without other flaws -- some of the gags don't work -- but it's an exciting thrill ride full of Yakuza vampires, guys in frog costumes (and a giant frog eater of worlds), and some fun martial arts action. Solid junk food.

film.summary: A war veteran's attempt to save a young girl from a sex trafficking ring goes horribly wrong.
film.quote: Occasionally reaches greatness but doesn't stay there. Phoenix puts in good work as per usual and I'm all for this type of movie, but there's a disconnect created by the fractured memories and chaotic presentation. Sometimes that gels together and the editing/music/sound design really does something special, but for the most part it's a good flick, one that is certainly a fun take on the genre.

film.filmname: Zack and Miri Make a Porno (2008)
film.summary: Lifelong platonic friends Zack (Rogen) and Miri (Banks) look to solve their respective cashflow problems by making an adult film together. As the cameras roll, however, the duo begin to sense that they may have more feelings for each other than they previously thought. (imdb)

A computer hacker's goal to discover the reason for human existence continually finds his work interrupted thanks to the Management; this time, they send a teenager and lusty love interest to distract him. (imdb)
film.quote: I actually liked it a bit more than Brazil, and I know that's strange. It might have been my mood when I watched Brazil, but that was so long ago I don't remember. But I love the visuals on display here, and I actually cared a little bit about the main character. The weirdness was appealing, and I generally had a good time watching this man stuck in a world overrun by technology and a job that looks like Minecraft. It's not real deep, but it's good enough to be worth thinking about.

film.summary: After America is ravaged by a zombie plague, a band of survivors fights the living dead while they cross the nation.
film.quote: Very funny stuff. Coulda used more badassery but what we got was fun enough. I'm not head over heels in love with this flick (not really head over heels in love with zombie flicks in general), I appreciate the fun romp that this is. It even has a little heart string tugging which feels genuine.

film.summary: The Zookeeper's Wife tells the account of keepers of the Warsaw Zoo, Jan and Antonina Zabinski, who helped save hundreds of people and animals during the Nazi invasion. (imdb)
film.quote: I don't expect a non-documentaryto hit all the factual beats, so some fictionalized ones are okay. I don't know much about this story but from the little I've now read there are some things I wish could have been in here. The jump to Jan fighting the Nazis was really jarring and it's upsetting that they didn't build to that at all, but this is an emotional movie with good performances. Nice to see original WW2 tales in movies. Also, Antonina has my views on humans vs animals. Fuck humans.

film.summary: Stranded in an Arctic mine, two lone survivors are forced to fight for their lives, evading and hiding from a new kind of terror. (imdb)
film.quote: This probably calls in between Rakka and Firebase. While Firebase had a great beginning, it tapered off a bit. This has a less inspired beginning, with a bunch of exposition, but that gets cooler and more interesting as it goes on. It's a rather simple short, just trying to escape from one place to another, doesn't end that satisfyingly (like them all) but creature who is stitched together from 96 of its other victims and retains their memories... that shit is horrifying with a great scream.

film.summary: Evan Treborn has lost track of time. From an early age, crucial moments of his life have disappeared into a black hole. Determined to do something now that he was incapable of doing then, Evan purposely travels back in time.

Everyone has experienced the mystery of deja vu, but what if the feelings were actually warnings sent from the past or clues to the future? It is deja vu that guides ATF agent Doug Carlin through an investigation into a shattering crime. Called in to recover evidence after a bomb sets off an explosion on a New Orleans Ferry, Carlin is about to discover that what most people believe "is only in their heads" is actually something far more powerful.
film.quote: The technology is really absurd but the action is exciting despite that. Denzel Washington gives another good performance. Just don't expect a plot that makes tons of sense, suspend your disbelief a lot, and this will be an entertaining movie.

film.summary: Neo and the rebel leaders estimate that they have 72 hours until 250,000 probes discover Zion and destroy it and its inhabitants. During this, Neo must decide how he can save Trinity from a dark fate in his dreams.

A secret experiment...a deadly virus...a fatal mistake. Based on the wildly popular video game series, Resident Evil is an action-packed thriller starring Milla Jovovich in a battle of good and evil, human versus computer, the living against the Undead. (Sony Pictures)

Underworld reimagines Vampires as a secretive clan of modern aristocratic sophisticates whose mortal enemies are the Lycans (werewolves), a shrewd gang of street thugs who prowl the city&#039;s underbelly. (Screen Gems)
film.quote: An entertaining enough vampire/werewolves romp with an attractive lead. A really attractive lead.

film.summary: A young man comforts his older brother's wife and children after he goes missing in Afghanistan.
film.quote: It was good. It didn't tug at me like the movieobviously wanted to but it was still pretty sad, with great peformances all around. Still, there were some really wonky parts amongst the great parts and the very last scene was a little uninspired (the scene before it was great though)

film.summary: Born with a gift he didn&#039;t want, the ability to clearly recognize the half-breed angels and demons that walk the earth in human skin, Constantine (Reeves) was driven to take his own life to escape the tormenting clarity of his vision. But he failed. Resuscitated against his will, he found himself cast back into the land of the living. Now, marked as an attempted suicide with a temporary lease on life, he patrols the earthly border between heaven and hell, hoping in vain to earn his way to salvation by sending the devil&#039;s foot soldiers back to the depths. (Warner Bros.)
film.quote: Even though it basically shits all over the comic book, it's a moody thriller that makes you want to smoke. I'm kidding about the smoking thing... sort of. Keanu Reeves gives a decent enough performance and the action is pretty entertaining as well. It's not even close to being a great movie but if you want a religious theme thriller with demon killing, and don't want to have to think, here's a decent enough one.

film.summary: When a secret governmant agency re-programs a criminal named Nikita (Parillaud), she is released to the outside world as their agent. As her missions become more and more demanding, she is torn between her alliance to the agency and her desire to lead, for once, a normal life. (20th Century Fox)
film.quote: Liked it but didn't love it. The psychological elements of it are interesting enough, how Nikita loses her individuality because of a coersive government. I think the blue tint works well enough, but there were some quirky parts I didn't care for that made it all seem just... really silly and it didn't really seem like the right movie for that. The action, when it happens, is pretty good too. Jean Reno = Awesome.

film.summary: Two sisters find their relationship challenged as a nearby planet threatens to collide into the Earth. (imdb)
film.quote: Quite a step down from Antichrist and a little disappointing (expectations reign), but it was still a good movie. The beginning and end = amazing, and are very memorable. Everyone does a really good job acting here, but big big props to Dunst (and her boobies), who I've never seen as a great actress before. Good direction in pretty much every way and incredible music (I like how it's pretty much one song). But I couldn't get engaged, it just kind of plods along.

film.filmname: The Men Who Stare at Goats (2009)
film.summary: A reporter in Iraq might just have the story of a lifetime when he meets Lyn Cassady, a guy who claims to be a former member of the U.S. Army's First Earth Battalion, a unit that employs paranormal powers in their missions.
film.quote: It does feel like The Informant in some ways, like someone else said but I liked this a lot more. Maybe it's because I understood the jokes more, and I understood what they were talking about more often. I love the cast here and without them this would be worse. The problem is that it goes for pretty long stretches without a laugh (but has some great ones) and this movie isn't the most emotional thing ever so you're left with a few too many parts where you feel nothing. Still, a good flick.

film.summary: Three unknowing martial artists are summoned to a mysterious island to compete in a tournament whose outcome will decide the fate of the world (imdb)

A raucous comedy about a trio of thirty-something buddies who try to recapture the outrageous, irrepressible fun of their college years by starting their own off-campus frat house. (DreamWorks Pictures)
After a zombie becomes involved with the girlfriend of one of his victims, their romance sets in motion a sequence of events that might transform the entire lifeless world. (imdb)
film.quote: A few more laughs would have pushed this over into an 80 for me. The beginning I found really funny then the laughter sort of died out for a bit. It's not necessarily bad because the drama took over and it's surprisingly emotional. Still, it just got a few minor chuckles here and there as it went on so while it didn't live up to the standard it started with, this is a movie like Twilight but much much better.

film.summary: Lemmy Caution, an American private-eye, arrives in Alphaville, a futuristic city on another planet.... (imdb)
An experimental short film by Maya Deren.

A boy finds a balloon - or is it the other way around? Together the pair wanders the beautiful streets of Paris, coping with grownups and the local bands of childrens. When one of the pair disappears, the loss is but temporary... (imdb)
film.quote: No don't leave that balloon outside it'll fly away! Wait it isn't? Holy crap! Man, the death of the balloon is gruesome. It's like American History Balloon or something. I think the balloon should have gotten an Oscar. Anyway, you can examine this movie and what it means, but even on the surface... somehow 35 minutes of basically watching a balloon chill out wasn't boring. Wu-Tang is for the kids! Er... sorry, The Red Balloon is for the kids! Seriously, make your kids watch this.

film.summary: When a corrupt businessman and the grotesque Penguin plot to take control of Gotham City, only Batman can stop them, while the Catwoman has her own agenda.

Hsiao-hsien's landmark epic uses the story of a single family to reflect the most chaotic period in Taiwan's history: four years that witness the end of Japanese occupation, mass migrations from the mainland, and the rise of martial law.
film.quote: It failed to really get me involved despite the fact the kind of stuff it tackled really appealed to me. It's solid film making, don't get me wrong, I just failed to get engaged. I wish I could give it a higher store.

film.summary: The last dragon and a disillusioned dragonslaying knight must cooperate to stop an evil king who was given partial immortality. (imdb)
Lancelot falls in love with Guinevere, who is due to be married to King Arthur. Meanwhile, a violent warlord tries to seize power from Arthur and his Knights of the Round Table.
A young writer who follows strangers for material meets a thief who takes him under his wing. (imdb)
film.quote: Really entertaining idea executed well. Story telling can still bloom despite low budgets and this just proves that idea. Though it's not as good as his other films, this is a great beginning point for Nolan.

film.filmname: He Died with a Felafel in His Hand (2001)
film.summary: A search for love, meaning and bathroom solitude. Danny goes through a series of shared housing experiences in a succession of cities on the east coast of Australia. Together these vignettes form a narrative that is surprisingly reflective. (imdb)
film.quote: Definitely a clever movie, had some funny parts, had some good performance and some memorable characters. I wouldn't go as far as to say this is a great movie but it's good.

film.summary: A gang of robbers, lead by career criminal Charlie Croker, create the largest traffic jam in Los Angeles history, giving them time to pull off a theft of gold bullion. They get away in their Mini Coopers, which are small enough to drive on sidewalks so they can make a clean get away before the traffic jam clears.

film.filmname: Pirates of the Caribbean: Dead Man's Chest (2006)
film.summary: Johnny Depp, Orlando Bloom and Keira Knightley reunite this epic tale chronicling the further mis-adventures of Captain Jack Sparrow. (Buena Vista Pictures)
A human drama about the struggle of a true genius, inspired by events in the life of John Forbes Nash, Jr.

Frank W. Abagnale (DiCaprio) worked as a doctor, a lawyer and as a co-pilot for a major airline -- all before his 21st birthday. A master of deception, he was also a brilliant forger, whose skill at check fraud had netted him millions of dollars in stolen funds. FBI agent Carl Hanratty (Hanks) has made it his prime mission to capture Frank and bring him to justice, but Frank is always one step ahead of him, baiting him to continue the chase. (DreamWorks)
film.quote: Solid and above average the entire way through. Not a great movie but good. DiCaprio is wonderful and so is Hanks, though this is really no surprise.

film.summary: Jake Vig (Burns) is a consummate grifter about to pull his biggest con yet, one set to avenge his friend's murder. But his last scam backfired, leaving him indebted to a mob boss (Hoffman) and his enforcer. (imdb)
film.quote: Well Ed Burns oozed charm. In fact, the whole cast was pretty solid. The story is complicated enough to be interesting and require some thought. It's a decent entertainment and that's good enough!

film.filmname: Fear and Loathing in Las Vegas (1998)
film.summary: When a writing assignment lands journalist Raoul Duke and sidekick Dr. Gonzo in Las Vegas, they decide to make it the ultimate business trip. But before long, business is forgotten and trip has become the key word. Fueled by a suitcase full of mind-bending pharmaceuticals, Duke and Gonzo set off on a fast and furious ride through nonstop neon, surreal surroundings and a crew of the craziest characters ever.
film.quote: Despite the imagery (Gilliam seems to be good at that..), I wasn't pulled into the drug fueled world that this created. Depp did well enough and nailed Thompsons mannerisms but this doesn't hit the urgency that the incredible novel does.

film.summary: A romantic comedy set against the backdrop of America's nascent pro-football league in 1925.
film.quote: I went to see it because I was bored and was pretty surprised. It feels like a Coens brother movie, Clooney is charming as usual and does a fine job directing. It also shows how commercialism invaded football.

film.summary: A shy and mute seamstress goes insane after being attacked and raped twice in one day, in which she takes to the streets of New York after dark and randomly kills men with a .45 caliber gun. (imdb)

Special agent Frank Castle had it all: A loving family, a great life, and an adventurous job. But when his life is taken away from him by a ruthless criminal and his associates, Frank has become reborn. Now serving as judge, jury, and executioner, he's a new kind of vigilante out to wage a one man war against those who have done him wrong. (imdb)
film.quote: Sometimes you just want to see someone get revenge. It's not a great film but it's pretty mindless action.

film.summary: Set in the lowlands of North Carolina, this story follows the rite of passage of a jaded, aimless high school senior (West) as he falls in love with a guileless young woman (Moore) he and his friends once scorned. (Warner Brothers)
film.quote: I blubber up.

film.summary: After getting in a car accident, a woman is held in a shelter by two men, who claim the outside world is affected by a widespread chemical attack. (imdb)
film.quote: First thing's first: Goodman is terrifying when he's angry. Winstead is great too but god damn Goodman you're awesome. Besides that, I enjoyed almost the entire time in the bunker, but felt that the final act fell flat. It was incredibly unsatisfying after all that build, and this didn't need to be a Cloverfield "sequel." In fact, I would say that throwing the name on it and forcing it in hurt the film immensely. Still enjoyed the flick though based on the dialogue and strength of the leads.

film.summary: It is 1987 and Jenna is a 13-year-old girl on the brink of womanhood. The problem is that adulthood is just not arriving fast enough. She makes a wish on her birthday: If only she could be all grown up, she'd have the life she's always wanted. Miraculously, her wish comes true. (Columbia Pictures)
film.quote: What? So I liked this. Wanna fight about it?

film.summary: The story of how two men change -- and change each other -- during a tense 16 block struggle between life and death. (Warner Bros.)

28 Weeks Later, the follow up to 28 Days Later, picks up six months after the rage virus has annihilated the Mainland Britain. The U.S. Army declares that the war against infection has been won, and that the reconstruction of the country can begin. As the first wave of refugees return, a family is reunited, but one of them unwittingly carries a terrible secret. The virus is not yet dead, and this time, it is more dangerous than ever. (Fox Atomic)
film.quote: Although I think the fact the father could think fairly logically after being infected is just a cheap way to make suspense (unless I'm missing something here), I still enjoy the rest of the movie. It's scary, hits a right on atmosphere, has great music, and some chilling and memorable scenes.

film.summary: A woman learns that her brother has relapsed on heroin. (imdb)
film.quote: Unflinching in its delivery to the point that it's uncomfortable. You don't necessarily like these people, even Abbi Jacobson's character who means well but makes odd decisions; for that reason some people will hate this because a lot of people need a hero to cheer for. It's not even entertaining really, at least not in a conventional sense, but it's interesting because of how much it commits to its devastation. Not the greatest drug movie of all-time by any means but definitely worth a watch.

film.summary: A group of Iraq War veterans looks to clear their name with the U.S. military, who suspect the four men of committing a crime for which they were framed.
film.quote: Does what it sets out to do. It's pretty funny and some of the action scenes (flying the tank) were pretty awesome. In some scenes they really cheaped out but it's forgiven.

film.summary: A drama centered on a troubled young woman who moves to San Francisco, where she gets involved in pornography and aligns herself with a cocaine-addicted lawyer. (imdb)
film.quote: I agree with Rufflesack that the ending felt weird and out of place. In fact, I actually thought the movie was a solid take on the "girl getting into porn" idea... Hinshaw played a tragic character but the movie wasn't just like GIRLS WHO ARE IN PORN ARE DAMAGED, which is nice. I mean, she is, but it isn't her only reason for doing it, and porn isn't treated like the devil in this movie. Good performance by her, rest of the movie was good, but deserved a better ending. Hot sexual scenes too.

film.summary: An unprecedented blend of real-life heroism and original filmmaking, Act of Valor stars a group of active-duty Navy SEALs in a powerful story of contemporary global anti-terrorism. Inspired by true events, the film combines stunning combat sequences, up-to-the minute battlefield technology and heart-pumping emotion for the ultimate action adventure. (imdb)
film.quote: It's really hard to get past the general "yay America and yay the SEALs" feeling, but I mean I knew this going in. I didn't really go in for a super engaging story... I went in for cool action scenes and I enjoyed them all. The movie definitely has its share of lame movie moments that kind of break the realism but for the most part it's gritty and interesting, and the wonky acting can't stop how fun it is. Plus even the FPS moments worked.

film.summary: Two strangers' lives become inextricably bound together after a devastating plane crash.
film.quote: I guess it got to me a little more than others, it seems. While Arnold isn't giving a truly great performance, he's basically as good as he's going to get, which is still pretty damn good. I enjoyed the slow build for the most part and the tonal shift didn't come across as forced or unnecessary; it gelled well and felt fitting. It can get a little tedious here and there, but it said what it needed to say and the final music that plays was really effective. Underrated.

film.summary: A guy keeps getting painfully rejected (bodily harm) when he asks girls out. (imdb)
film.quote: It's not what he would become, but it's still a fun short. It's silly, has a catchy little tune that permeates throughout the entire thing, and it was clearly his feelings at the time regarding getting rejected. It's important to note that it's not every female, so calling it misogynistic is a really far fetched... it's just his experience, I'm sure Don never thought all women were gold diggers. You know how people are when they're angry. When he walks past that one girl I laughed.

film.summary: An action-packed story of one young woman's journey to discover the truth of who she is and her fight to change the world. (imdb)
film.quote: It's certainly entertaining. Alita is a good character that can be a badass while also invoking some emotion. The action sequences are satisfying all around but I wouldn't say they're incredibly noteworthy. The world is realized just enough to be interesting while also not being incredibly noteworthy. The thing that lets this down is how hokey it is. There is so much bad dialogue here, especially from that hulk that called her little flea. Some scenes are a little much, as well.

film.summary: Versatile filmmaker Nick Cassavetes directs an impressive group of both young and veteran performers in Alpha Dog, inspired by actual events, a film that follows three fateful days when the lives of a group of Southern California teens suddenly dead-ended. (Universal)
film.quote: Saw this as a last minute switch and it surprised me a few times. It ended up being a solid movie. Justin Timberlake broke my heart near the end, proving he can act (even if he does just act like a thug throughout most of it.) I ended up caring deepy for these people, even though normally I wouldn't. Could have gone wrong but it didn't.

film.summary: Against a backdrop of bizarre shapes and textures, a small organic figure gives birth to the letters of the alphabet while a mixture of children's voices and an operatic tune are singing out. The figure's head collapses causing blood to rain on a girl while she lays in her bed, resulting in the girl violently vomiting blood herself. (imdb)
film.quote: Really like the ending. Interesting idea too.

film.summary: Peter Parker runs the gauntlet as the mysterious company Oscorp sends up a slew of supervillains against him, impacting on his life. (imdb)
film.quote: I think I enjoy it about as much as the last one. It shouldn't have thrown in Harry as a villain and just left it until next time, and that godawful cliffhanger ending actually pisses me off, but I enjoy Garfield as Spidey, and enjoy the two reboots more than the original trilogy. It's dark but still mildly humorous, the action is fun and the visuals are impressive. The Gwen subplot gave some emotional impact, and all-in-all, I had a good time.

film.summary: A story centered on counterterrorism agent Mitch Rapp.
film.quote: Counter point to the hate: it's a fun little spy/action movie. It actually goes a little grittier than some other movies of the same ilk, and Keaton was entertaining. I mean, it doesn't have a whole lot going for it but it's put together well enough and I enjoyed the two hours I spent with it, wasn't bored. The ending was a little wonky though.

film.summary: Generally unheralded at the time, the early 1980s hardcore punk rock scene gave birth to much of the rock music and culture that followed. Hardcore was more than music -- it was a social movement created by Reagan-era misfit kids. The participants constituted a tribe unto themselves -- some finding a voiced, others an escape in the hard-edged music. Ans while some sought a better world, others were just angry and wanted to raise hell. American Hardcore traces this lost subculture, from its early roots in 1980 to its initial flameout in 1986. (Sony Pictures Classics)
film.quote: It's okay, really, could have been tons better. It's good for those who don't know much about it because they can get their foot in the door and learn about some bands but it doesn't really go beyond that in most cases. Still worth a watch, though.

film.summary: A Navy S.E.A.L. recounts his military career, which includes more than 150 confirmed kills. (imdb)
film.quote: I enjoyed it, ultimately, but it's flawed. It doesn't spend enough time actually dealing with the issues it sets up. The beginning though is incredible, and that's why they chose to edit that and make it the trailer. At some point though, you realize you're kinda just watching a war movie. It never gets boring, and the action is directed well, but it doesn't have the emotional impact that I hoped for. Cooper put in another great performance, though.

film.summary: The true saga of a working-class Everyman who pursues self-expression without self-censorship -- and finds a grateful audience, critical admiration, and that most remarkable of happy endings, a loving family. (Fine Line Features)
Photo-animated feature documentary, uniquely narrated by the 10 people who knew Bill best. (imdb)
film.quote: Not a bad look into Bill Hicks by any means. That's all it tries to be, except they use an interesting (though sometimes off-putting) visual style. A good documentary for a brilliant comedian.

film.summary: After losing his job, his girlfriend, and his apartment in a single day, a young man attempts to restart his life, but is diverted when he meets a woman who shares his strangest habit
film.quote: It's good, it does most things well but doesn't exceed that. I have to admit that I was curious how it would handle the "strangest habit" but found that it didn't amount to anything substantial. There's a disgusting scene but it felt fast-tracked, and anywhere that calls this is a horror movie is grossly mislabeling it. Ultimately just a slightly strange romance movie but it had a little too much distance between viewer and movie to create a memorable relationship.

film.summary: After he's attacked on the street at night, timid bookkeeper Casey joins a neighborhood karate studio. Under the watchful eye of a charismatic instructor, Sensei, and hardcore brown belt Anna, Casey gains a newfound sense of confidence for the first time in his life. But when he attends Sensei's mysterious night classes, he discovers a sinister world of fraternity, brutality and hyper-masculinity, presenting a journey that places him squarely in the sights of his enigmatic new mentor.
film.quote: I really need more characters to dissect this, but simply put, if you follow the rhetoric these days of toxic masculinity then you probably agree with the message here. There's some truth, but it's not nuanced enough to give an accurate depiction. Besides that, just as a film, it's good. Uncomfortable, usually interesting, some brutal moments, some dry comedy, good performances all around, a little unpredictable. Gets compared to Fight Club--it's not nearly that clever, but still entertaining.

film.summary: A broken-hearted hit man moves to the desert where he finds skilled swordsmen to carry out his contract killings.
film.quote: I don't know if the fight scenes really work for me here. Not sure. But what I do know is that the movie is absolutely beautiful and it is an interesting take on wuxia. I, like others, found it extremely confusing and I don't know if that's due to the writing or just me being stupid. I also enjoy the score and at the end there was a scene that really involved me but most of the time I was unable to truly get into it.

film.summary: Jim is an average New Yorker living a peaceful life with a well paying job and a loving family. Suddenly, everything changes when the economy crashes causing Jim to lose everything. Filled with anger and rage, Jim snaps and goes to extreme lengths to seek revenge for the life taken from him. (imdb)
film.quote: You know, I gotta say I enjoyed this. The build up wasn't always great, but it was mostly well done and it was a pretty gruesome and dark finale. I would love to sit here and pick it apart because it's Boll, but shit, I had a good time.

film.summary: “Atlantiques” tells the story of a young woman from Dakar, whose fast-paced lifestyle is disrupted by the sudden disappearance of her lover. (indiewire)
film.quote: Directed well; nice sense of atmosphere with great music to aid in that. Acted well, with a nice supernatural spin to the romance. I didn't see any glaring flaws but I also don't think that it had the emotional oomph that something like this needed, so it ended up being merely good instead of great.

film.summary: Jacq Vaucan, an insurance agent of ROC robotics corporation, routinely investigates the case of manipulating a robot. What he discovers will have profound consequences for the future of humanity. (imdb)
film.quote: It's refreshing to see a Sci-Fi movie about AI and robots that become self-aware that doesn't actually make them bad guys. The premise of this is interesting because of that. However, there's some hokey acting here, it overstays its welcome a little bit, and the pacing is off on occasion. It's still a well shot movie with nice music, special effects and cinematography, but it doesn't end up being anything incredibly captivating.

film.summary: A paraplegic marine dispatched to the moon Pandora on a unique mission becomes torn between following his orders and protecting the world he feels is his home.
film.quote: Lame, lame, AWESOME, good, lame AWESOME, good, lame, good. AWESOME. That's pretty much how I went through this movie. It's visually beautiful and I like the effort put into the world but the script isn't anything amazing and is very inconsistent and plays to a few stupid Hollywood conventions. I appreciate the armed rebellion aspect but it should have gone deeper into it. Still, it's a very good sci-fi flick that everyone should see.

film.summary: After being coerced into working for a crime boss, a young getaway driver finds himself taking part in a heist doomed to fail. (imdb)
film.quote: There's a lot to admire here: a particular scene later on when shit hits the fan is amazing, the way the events move to the music is lovely, the soundtrack is pretty good, and Spacey is doing it real good as usual. But this didn't hit me real hard... there's a huge lull at one point, I think the acting is sold but not exceptional, I didn't laugh much, and stylistically this comes across as mostly more normal than previous Wright material. Still good but I'm underwhelmed.

film.summary: Lauren Bacall tells the story of her late husband Humphrey Bogart, presenting clips from his movies and interview clips with his peers. (imdb)
film.quote: Probably should have been called, "A rundown of his movies and oh yeah, Bacall talks a little bit about him too," but I suppose that title is too long. However, there were clips from shows and rarely seen other clips so it was cool, and things like the home movies and whatnot were really interesting. You get pretty much all positive things about Bogie, and the end was emotional and very well done. I suppose I just wanted more about him and their life, but it does what it sets out to do.

film.summary: One hundred million dollars worth of confiscated heroin has just been jacked from police custody. Once the career bust of Detective Mike Lowery (Smith) and Marcus Burnett (Lawrence), the missing drugs now threaten to shut down the narcotics division of the Miami Police Department. (Sony)
film.quote: Explosion!

film.summary: Dramatization of the Starkweather-Fugate killing spree of the 1950&#039;s, in which a teenage girl and her twenty-something boyfriend slaughtered her entire family and several others in the Dakota badlands (imdb)
film.quote: I might be a minority here but I'm not such a fan. I think like all of Malick's films, it's well made and interesting, but it fails to pull me in completely. I'm always almost there but not quite, except for a part or two.

film.summary: Perrault's fairy tale presented in claymation with choral voices. Bluebeard goes courting, all six of his wives having died. He arrives at the house of a widow with two daughters. He's greatly feared, but he overcomes objections with a generous dowry. One sister (Anne) refuses him; the other accepts. At his castle, the damsel delights in precious minutes away from Bluebeard in the rose garden... (imdb)
film.quote: Interesting folk tale, always enjoy claymation, enjoyed the songs, especially Bluebeard's theme when he first shows up. Not exceptional as a whole but a very nice little short film.

film.summary: A 6-story anthology collection in a time-line after "Batman Begins". In "Have I Got A Story For You", 3 kids tell wildly different stories about Batman. "Crossfire" focuses on two policemen who end up getting in the middle of a crime battle. "Field Test" has Lucius Fox creating a new technology for Batman. "In Darkness Dwells" features Killer Croc and Scarecrow. "Working Through Pain" goes through flashbacks of Bruce Wayne's training. "Deadshot" focuses on the titular sniper.
film.quote: 1: Just love Batman so I'm easy to impress. 2: The animation in the first one was awful and didn't work at all. The animation was uneven in general, some was great, some was not. 3: Even so, the story in the first was good. Liked the story in most of them, especially "Working Through Pain." To seasoned Batman fans, the views into his psych aren't original but even so it's interesting. Field Test and "Have I Got A Story For You" are the weakest links. But all in all it's a good watch.

film.summary: Probably no one in the public listening to the orchestra's rendition of Ravel's Bolero notices him but the drummer is a regular hero. For, although his mind is assailed by loads of unsettling thoughts and worries, he tries to keep the rhythm at any cost. He knows all too well that he falls out of time only once all the magic of the piece will vanish. Will the drummer hold on till the end...? (imdb)
film.quote: It's pretty funny and actually kinda made me think: This is one of those things in music that has always baffled me... how somebody can sit there and do something like the drummer in this does, for as long as the drummer does. I won't even say it overstays its welcome (though it's true nothing really happens), because I think this is the point.

film.summary: Led by their skillful staff sergeant (Aaron Eckhart), a platoon of gutsy Marines, including Santos (Michelle Rodriguez), Simmons (Taylor Handley) and Lockett (Cory Hardrict), fight to protect all humankind from astonishingly powerful aliens who've suddenly invaded Los Angeles.
film.quote: Critics stink on this one. I agree that there are a lot of cliches and in a lot of ways it's conventional. However, I felt like there were a lot of intense scenes, especially the beginning. It does great job of escalating the action, introducing obstacles to get by. Sure, the characters aren't fleshed out but the movie mostly takes place in the here and now, showcasing alien colonization. It felt epic and delivered on what it set out to do. Do you want them to sit around and have a tea party?

film.summary: An aimless teenager on the outer edges of Brooklyn struggles to escape his bleak home life and navigate questions of self-identity, as he balances his time between his delinquent friends, a potential new girlfriend, and older men he meets online. (imdb)
film.quote: Yeah, not a whole lot happens in Beach Rats but the music and performances are both good enough to at least make this a pretty good flick. I wasn't bored at any point, which is kind of surprising when I think back about what exactly happened and how it unfolded. I enjoy the ending, however, it was pretty beautiful.

film.summary: Michael Keaton is the name in laughter from the hereafter as an obnoxious poltergeist conjured up to bedevil an unwanted family of oddballs. (Warner Bros)

At a girls' school in Virginia during the Civil War, where the young women have been sheltered from the outside world, a wounded Union soldier is taken in. Soon, the house is taken over with sexual tension, rivalries, and an unexpected turn of events. (imdb)
film.quote: Good but flawed. The character development isn't really there, making it difficult to invest in any of these characters. The relationships between the girls and the man feel forced. The photography is great though, using the locale very effectively; views from the outside a lot, whether it's the trees, someone looking to the outside world, etc, which in turn makes this house feel isolated. When it kicks it up a notch it gets more tense but then it's also rushed, not using the time wisely.

film.summary: "The Believer" explores a Jewish student's private journey to understand the meaning of Judaism in his life. Set in New York City, the Plot follows a morally confused young adult struggling with the conflict between his beliefs and his heritage. "The Believer" examines themes of religion, family, and self-loathing. It is a psychological examination into the forces of intolerance, both on the individual and society as a whole. (imdb)
film.quote: Props to Gosling, as usual, and props to the ending. At first I didn't think I'd like this very much but it became quite interesting and original. It was more of a mind fuck than I thought it would be and I did end up enjoying the script quite a bit. There are some poor choices made occasionally in regards to direction but meh, not a big deal.

film.summary: Exposed during an illegal arms trade gone wrong in Berlin, a North Korean "ghost" agent finds himself in the crosshairs of an international manhunt. Was he betrayed by his wife or his country? He must prepare to make the ultimate sacrifice. (imdb)
film.quote: I've seen a bunch of negative reviews about this, saying it's confusing and a mess. It's confusing because it's got a lot of twists and turns, though I will concede that it could have been a little tighter written. The script wasn't bad though. I don't really see how it's a mess, and it had a decent flow to it. Most importantly, when the action came, it was thrilling and well made. I look forward to the sequel.

film.summary: Heartfelt documentry focusing on the lives of professional wrestlers and how their sport is not fake. (imdb)
film.quote: WRESTLING IS AWESOME. Unfortunately it does some damage, whether it be physical (like in the case of Foley or Funk) or mental (Jake). This is nothing I didn't know, and wrestling fans probably had an idea of a lot of this anyway... but to those haters of pro-wrestling, who only dismiss it as fake and don't see how it's theatre, they should watch it. It's put together well, it tells a good narrative, it's touching in places. It's pro-wraaaaaaasslin.

film.summary: The best-selling mobile game, Rovio's &quot;Angry Birds&quot;, told in the style of Alfred Hitchcock's 1963 classic &quot;The Birds&quot;. (imdb)
film.quote: Nice little homage to The Birds.

film.summary: Birds of all kinds suddenly begin to attack people, in increasing numbers and with increasing viciousness. (imdb)
film.quote: Certainly has good elements like the attention to detail to actually make the birds scary, but this is not a Hitchcock movie that I absolutely adore. Suspense/horror films work better when there's good build but this goes from that to a little boring before stuff starts kicking it up. The finale is thrilling as the birds attack but I'm not so sure I like the actual ending. Still an entertaining flick but I'm disappointed while also being impressed by what it would have taken to make this in 63.

film.summary: 123 elite U.S. soldiers drop into Somalia to capture two top lieutenants of a renegade warlord and find themselves in a desperate battle with a large force of heavily-armed Somalis. (imdb)
A lateral descent through the midnight blues and blacks of ice and the refracted colors from absorbed oils. (imdb)
film.quote: I'm not really sure what to say so er... it's kinda pretty. I'm not going to watch it again though.

film.summary: The true story of Whitey Bulger, the brother of a state senator and the most infamous violent criminal in the history of South Boston, who became an FBI informant to take down a Mafia family invading his turf. (imdb)
film.quote: I don't think it redefines the wheel in any way, but I dug Depp in the role (great performance, won't and shouldn't win awards though), and for the most part I was engaged. It dragged a little bit here and there, but it covered a fair bit of ground. Could have explored certain parts of Bulger's life better, but it's a completely solid gangster flick.

film.summary: A furloughed convict and his American and Chinese partners as they hunt a high-level cybercrime network from Chicago to Los Angeles to Hong Kong to Jakarta. (imdb)
film.quote: When it's being a cyber-thriller, it's tense and interesting. Mann delivers another street shootout which is not quite Heat but it's great. In fact, the shootouts are a highlight with wonderful music backing them. The soundtrack as a whole is great. It loses its way at the end though, with the way everything becomes a little too convenient and unbelievable. Why can a huge group not see the guns? Shouldn't have made Hemsworth a super badass at everything. Weak writing at times as well.

film.summary: Ron Stallworth, an African-American police officer from Colorado, successfully managed to infiltrate the local Ku Klux Klan and became the head of the local chapter. (imdb)
film.quote: The bookends were effective, hitting the notes that Lee wanted. As a statement I appreciate the militant approach, and I think art needs more of that, but as a movie? It dragged really hard. Scenes went on too long, while trying to draw parallels he sometimes lost momentum. But Driver and Washington were compelling, it was even sometimes funny, and the dialogue was written well in general. But sometimes he took the easy way out in developing characters, such as the KKK. Liked, didn't love.

film.summary: To ruin a western town, a corrupt political boss appoints a black sheriff, who promptly becomes his most formidable adversary. (imdb)
film.quote: It got off to a great start but the quality dipped a lot as it went on, becoming significantly less funny with more jokes that flop. However, I did really enjoy how it wrapped up, so it's just a shame that it is kind of middling for a while.

film.summary: Ray Garrison, a slain soldier, is re-animated with superpowers.
film.quote: I liked it. A couple decent plot twists and some fun action. Sure, the villain is just another corporate shithead which we see all the time in movies, but it didn't bother me that much. It's always hard to feel for Diesel because he's just not a good actor, but I didn't need to because what he is going through is easy to feel for. I suppose in a lot of ways this is disposable but I had a good time, much better than expected, so I'd say it's good.

film.summary: While grieving for the loss of their mother, the Connolly Sisters suddenly find they have a crime to cover up, leading them deep into the underbelly of their salty Maine fishing village.
film.quote: Started off really promising, felt like it was going to be more original. Ultimately it became a good murder mystery, which I'm completely okay with, but it could have been more. I liked seeing this kind of flick in a different type of setting, for the most part the acting was solid, but it lacked the kind of oomph that this kind of flick might need to put it over more. Thought the soundtrack was neat, directing was fine and I'm looking forward to seeing whatever they do next.

film.summary: In this follow-up to &#034;Smoke,&#034; it&#039;s nonstop laughs when a wacky group of locals visits the neighborhood cigar shop, looking for good times ... and finding plenty of hilarious fun! But when the greedy owner threatens to close the shop for good -- and turn it into a trendy vegetarian restaurant -- the neighborhood proves they&#039;ll do just about anything to save their favorite hangout! (Miramax)
film.quote: There's some solid acting by everyone involved but I really liked Michael J. Fox and Harvey Keitel. The documentary style parts are pretty interesting, talking about life in Brooklyn. It's not a flashy movie and it's cool that it's mostly improv. There are some funny parts too but it's not overly hilarious.

film.summary: A former journalist injured in the Iraq war is hired by the CIA to track down an Al Qaeda leader in Jordan. Based on the novel "Body of Lies" by David Ignatius
film.quote: It really heavily relies on the actors to make it believable and despite what goes on, you should mostly believe it, or at least suspend your disbelief long enough to enjoy it. DiCaprio impressed me again but everyone was great. There's not much else that's great about it, though. The direction is rock solid, but it's Scott so you can expect that even if he's made some stinkers in his career (who hasn't?). It's a solid political thriller, see it once, never watch it again.

film.summary: A crime-drama, about the cultural aversion of a group of punk rockers in a conservative Texas town. Their ongoing battle with a rival, more-affluent clique leads to a controversial hate crime that questions the morality of American justice. (imdb)
film.quote: Important, though I'm no expert on the actual incident so I don't know how much is moviefied. But I wouldn't say it's an awesome movie; the bookends are both great and some of the music is really excellent, adding to the tension, gravitas and dread. The part in the middle is decent, always entertaining but doesn't go beyond that. So it ends up being a good movie, not a great one. I would have liked a slightly deeper dive into the politics and characters.

film.summary: The film tells a story of a divorced couple (Ethan Hawke and Patricia Arquette) trying to raise their young son. The story follows the boy for twelve years, from first grade at age 6 through 12th grade at age 17-18, and examines his relationship with his parents as he grows. (Tmdb)
film.quote: I thought I might absolutely love this because the opening scene, with Yellow, was profound to me for some reason. But as it went on, I started to realize I would merely like it. Which isn't bad by any means because I enjoyed myself, but it didn't grab me like it could have and didn't make me feel as emotional as it should have. However, great direction, the "gimmick" of filming these people over 12 years is interesting, and it's impressive that it didn't lose control of itself.

film.summary: A Secret Service Agent is held captive in the trunk of a car and endures high-speed mental and physical torture as terrorists attempt to extract needed information for their sinister plot. (imdb)
film.quote: Not quite a Buried clone, but fairly close. This has more action but the lead performance isn't nearly as strong. The plot in this has more at stake so I think in that way it's a little better, but the writing isn't as strong. It was predictable but I'll admit the last twist got me. Up until then I had pretty much guessed everything. I'm glad that extra twist was there.

film.summary: William Wallace is a Scottish rebel who leads an uprising against the cruel English ruler Edward the Longshanks, who wishes to inherit the crown of Scotland for himself. When he was a young boy, William Wallace's father and brother, along with many others, lost their lives trying to free Scotland. Once he loses another of his loved ones, William Wallace begins his long quest to make Scotland free once and for all, along with the assistance of Robert the Bruce. (imdb)
A former boxer-turned-drug runner lands in a prison battleground after a deal gets deadly. (imdb)
film.quote: Certainly entertaining, not sure I'm seeing a movie worthy of the intense praise it seems to have gotten. I found most of the fight scenes lifeless, with the gory payoff the only interesting thing. Yet they didn't go far enough with the gore to make me grimace. But it was ridiculously silly, a nice genre piece that mashes up a prison drama and grindhouse... so it has that going for it. Vaughn gives no shits here, actually doing good work.

film.summary: Brazil is a surrealistic nightmare vision of a "perfect" future where technology reigns supreme. Everyone is monitored by a secret government agency that forbids love to interfere with efficiency. When a daydreaming bureaucrat (Pryce) becomes unwittingly involved with an underground superhero and a beautiful mystery woman, he becomes the tragic victim of his own romantic illusions. (Universal Pictures)
film.quote: Well it's a fantasy movie set in a technological dystopia. It mixes slapstick and a certain sadness of being in a dead end job in a society that is run by poorly maintained machines. It is a really visual movie... often times the stunning visuals actually take over the movie but I didn't really invest much into this movie, except for a couple scenes.

film.summary: Set in a world where mystical creatures live side by side with humans. A human cop is forced to work with an Orc to find a weapon everyone is prepared to kill for.
film.quote: This is competent and enjoyable for the most part, but it is flawed. Some of the dialogue is daft, and the script only hints at a compelling mythology; this could have been such a neat mash-up if they took the time to expand the lore rather than merely touching on it. It's a movie, the audience doesn't know everything that happened prior even if the characters do. I like Landis but the weakest part here is his writing, which feels weird to say. But still an enjoyable buddy cop fantasy flick.

film.summary: Set in the underworld of debt-collecting and follows the homegrown hustler Peg Dahl, who will do anything to escape Buffalo, NY. (imdb)
film.quote: It appears I'm a pretty big fan of Zoey Deutch because every time I see one of her movies I note how great she is. It's not that she puts in real emotional work most of the time, she's just incredibly charming in the roles I've seen her in. And that really counts because this movie, like some others, isn't really a GREAT flick, but she makes it entertaining. Her energy drives this. Otherwise it's pretty well written but not substantial. Some of her dialogue is witty.

film.summary: An African-American's eyewitness accounts of notable events of the 20th century during his tenure as a White House butler. (imdb)
film.quote: I didn't expect to like this at all and only watched it because it was put on and I happened to be there. While it's not exactly subtle, it was a surprisingly moving tale through a large period of time. Not overly memorable but it made me feel something. Better than expected.

film.summary: This documentary recounts the 90 mile voyage that poet John Clare took in 1841 to find his dead lover Mary Joyce.
film.quote: I enjoy the trickery and images here, and I like the experimental nature. Ultimately I don't think the subject matter is THAT interesting, it is a bit of a slog at times and you could gather more information about the actual walk from reading Wikipedia for 30 seconds. Still not a bad movie by any means... though the &quot;gimmicks&quot; save it admittedly.

film.summary: A lonely and disturbed cable guy raised on television just wants a new friend, but his target, a designer, rejects him, with bad consequences. (imdb)

A dying professor leaves his great-nephew a collection of documents pertaining to the Cthulhu Cult. The nephew begins to learn why the study of the cult so fascinated his grandfather. Bit-by-bit he begins piecing together the dread implications of his grandfather's inquiries, and soon he takes on investigating the Cthulhu cult as a crusade of his own.
film.quote: Sometimes it really feels its low budget, which I'm conflicted on. The worst offender is how Cthulhu itself looks... didn't feel as scary as it could have, which is a shame because when it appears it is framed in such a way that it should terrify. But I enjoyed it, the '20s vibe was fitting and it's a nice adaptation of interesting source material. Despite my gripes, some scenes are wonderful even though the film itself really isn't that scary.

film.summary: The project, scripted by Melfi and writer Chris Wehner, is about a young man (Grimes) who seeks out a father he has never met and, through no fault of his own, ends up barricaded in a liquor store with five other people on Christmas Eve. The story takes place in the fictitious town of El Camino, NV. (imdb)
film.quote: Outside of a couple laughs, generally by Tim Allen who is the star here, it doesn't really succeed as a comedy. The plot is not uncommon for a movie, but the reason these people are in there is a pretty decent setup. I enjoyed this a little more than I expected despite the shortcomings as a comedy because I actually felt something for these characters. By the end it made me a little emotional. So not a great flick by any means but another fun addition to Netflix.

film.summary: Set in a Chicago neighborhood nearly a decade after an occupation by an extra-terrestrial force, Captive State explores the lives on both sides of the conflict - the collaborators and dissidents.
film.quote: It's a good dystopian/alien invasion movie but nothing more. Goodman is always pleasant and everybody else is there, not standing out but not ruining scenes. The ending is strange in the sense that it ends exactly where it should for a cliffhanger but then they know that there won't be a sequel so in the credits it says that wars have broken out and the aliens are being overthrown, telling us the stuff we'd usually SEE in a sequel. I get that it's in line with the theme, but still.

film.summary: Think before you snap.
