film.summary: A Princeton admissions officer who is up for a major promotion takes a professional risk after she meets a college-bound alternative school kid who just might be the son she gave up years ago in a secret adoption. (imdb)
film.quote: Went in for a comedy, considering who stars in it, got a drama. So no, it's really not funny, but Fey does a good job in a dramatic role and I always like Rudd, regardless, because dude is charming. It does have an interesting premise, but I really just wish their were some laughs, because it's such a waste when it's not funny and it's marketed as a comedy AND you had Rudd and Fey. Decent flick though, really.

film.filmname: All the Boys Are Called Patrick (1959)
film.summary: Students Veronique and Charlotte meet the same man separately, who makes a date with each of them separately the next evening. When they both show up, he shows up, too, with a third women... (imdb)
film.quote: In english, we have a saying for people like the man in this short: Douchebag. The 20 minutes or so zoom on by. It's a simple film, and at first I felt like it was anti-climatic. Upon thinking about it some more, I can appreciate the ending. If there was a little more to this, I might give it a higher rating, but as it stands now... it's an entertaining but insubstantial short.

film.summary: In Aloha, a celebrated military contractor returns to the site of his greatest career triumphs - the US Space program in Honolulu, Hawaii - and reconnects with a long-ago love while unexpectedly falling for the hard-charging Air Force watchdog assigned to him. (imdb)
film.quote: Really, how often do you see a movie marketed as a romantic comedy also be about putting weapons in the sky? Some see "quirky," some see "incoherent," and I'm in the former. I laughed, I got invested. The three leads were good together, Baldwin was a gem. Now, I can't speak for how accurately represented the culture is by any means, I think the script needed work (or perhaps just be left alone to breathe), and Aloha is by no means a GREAT movie, but I still enjoyed myself.

film.summary: Peter Parker finds a clue that might help him understand why his parents disappeared when he was young. His path puts him on a collision course with Dr. Curt Connors, his father's former partner. (imdb)
film.quote: The first Spider-Man movie I'd say I really enjoyed. It has its flaws and wank parts, but everyone did well and I like Andrew as Peter Parker much better than Tobey. A darker feel, but keeps the Spider-Man personality in tact. Also for those seeing it in 3D... it's mostly unnecessary but doesn't get in the way like The Avengers did.

film.summary: When 11-year-old Gitty discovers that her beloved father is hiding a wealthy man in her family's silo in order to save their struggling farm, she is forced to choose between saving the man's life or protecting her family from the consequences of their actions. AMERICAN FABLE is a fairytale thriller set in the 1980s rural Midwest about a courageous girl living in a dark (imdb)
film.quote: Pretty great directorial effort going on here. The rural Midwest is made to look beautiful and horror-tinged at the same time, wonderful nature shots, creating an unsettling and foreboding atmosphere. Can't fault Hamilton, who interned for Malick and it shows. But the script is wonky; the mysterious figure on horseback adds zilch, the little girls' bro Martin is needlessly hostile from the beginning, and the internal logic is flaky, forcing drama. Comes across as too scripted, not organic.

film.summary: At a 1962 College, Dean Vernon Wormer is determined to expel the Delta House Fraternity, but those roughhousers have other plans for him. (imdb)
film.quote: I liked it, there's an endearing quality to the craziness on display that keeps it from being boring, but I didn't laugh nearly as much as some. It got a couple chuckles out of me but it needed more of that to be a good comedy.

film.summary: Based on the novel ANIMALS by Emma Jane Unsworth. (imdb)
film.quote: The chemistry between the two leads was noteworthy but I wouldn't say that the rest of the movie is. It does what it needs to do and explores what it needs to explore well, but not exceptionally. I like a few of the scenes a fair bit but it's still just a pretty good movie. I'm not really seeing the comedy, however, even though I think the script was intelligently written.

film.summary: Follows a man stranded in the Arctic, who is finally about to receive his long awaited rescue. However, after a tragic accident, his opportunity is lost and he must then decide whether to remain in the relative safety of his camp or embark on a deadly trek through the unknown for potential salvation. (imdb)
film.quote: I'm not a big survivalist film fan so any movie in the genre needs to do something special to make me think it's more than pretty good. This doesn't accomplish that, but I'll give it credit: Mads was great, it captured the loneliness well, it was shot well, the music was fitting. There were some great scenes, but as someone else said, the last 10 seconds or so kind of ruins the ending.

film.summary: A drunken playboy stands to lose a wealthy inheritance when he falls for a woman his family doesn't like.
film.quote: First of all, Greta won me over. Consider me a fan. Cute and charming as hell. Besides that, this is actually a pretty solid movie. I really didn't wanna see it, but I was bored today and it was there so I watched it. At first I was thinking, "This will be a 30 on Criticker" but then as the movie went on, I bought into it. At first the jokes didn't work, it was too many, too often. As the movie went on, the jokes got funnier... I started to chuckle, and then eventually laugh out loud.

film.summary: A thriller centered on two archaeologists in search of a lost treasure in the catacombs below Paris. (imdb)
film.quote: The found footage gimmick doesn't really work in this movie, but I'm a fan of the style generally. I give horror movies that aren't just about haunted houses more recognition than maybe I should because I'm so sick of those types. I give props to this because at least it's different with a cool setting and some intrigue. It doesn't reach its potential and loses some steam once it becomes very obvious which direction this is going. It's still a good time with some good scares and claustrophobia.

film.summary: A story of violent love within a time frame spanning from 2001 to 2017. (imdb)
film.quote: I really thought I was going to love this and I did up until she went to prison. Then it was just kind of there for quite a while before it regained some footing. But it was never the same. It's shot well with good performances and some fine musical cues; the problem is just that it meanders and it's hard to not tune out. That makes it hard to feel the emotional punch that it goes for since it was a struggle to connect due to the pacing.

film.summary: Three assassins deal with life, love, addiction and trust as each tries to find the answers to a better life. Together, they prove to be the most trustworthy in this tangled web of murder, greed, friendship and betrayal. (imdb)
film.quote: Inconsistent but ultimately a good time. I like Hitman movies, and the 3 main were fairly fleshed out with different personalities and dilemmas. Sometimes the stylish transitions and quirks just didn't flow and some of the music choices just took me out of it. The movie has a pretty thoughtful plot with a bunch of twists and turns so that's fine, but sometimes the dialogue felt like it tried way too hard to be clever and Tarantino-esque. Like they ramble about breakfast, but it's not cool.

film.filmname: Austin Powers: The Spy Who Shagged Me (1999)
film.summary: Austin (Myers) must time travel back to the Swinging Sixties, regain his mojo and save the world from destruction. (New Line Cinema)

film.filmname: Austin Powers: International Man of Mystery (1997)
film.summary: Austin Powers (Myers) is a 60's spy who is cryonically frozen and released in the 1990's. The world is a very different place for Powers. Unfortuantly for Austin, everyone is no longer sex-mad. Although he may be in a different decade, his mission is still the same. He has teamed up with Vanessa Kensington (Hurley) to stop the evil Dr. Evil (Myers), who was also frozen in the past. Dr. Evil stole a nuclear weapon and is demanding a payment of (when he realises its the 90's) 100 billion dollars. (imdb)
Three friends are asked to be bridesmaids at a wedding of a woman they used to ridicule back in high school. (imdb)
film.quote: Pretty by the books. Not as funny as Bridesmaids last year, but not terrible either.

film.summary: The Bad Boys Mike Lowrey and Marcus Burnett are back together for one last ride in the highly anticipated Bad Boys for Life.
film.quote: Entertaining and I like who the villain ends up being. Lawrence and Smith still have chemistry, there's a few good jokes and the action is decent. It's an okay example of the action genre but doesn't reach any higher than that.

film.summary: A slobbering St Bernard dog becomes the center of attention for a loving family but its vet secretly wants to kill him.
film.quote: Haven't seen it since it was a kid so my memory is a little bad now. But as a kid, I loved it.

film.summary: A suburban teenager comes of age under the destructive guidance of his best friend, an aimless college dropout. (imdb)
film.quote: It's fine all across the board but doesn't do a whole lot to separate itself in the coming-of-age genre. It's not as funny as some, nor as emotional as others; it exists in this in-between space where I can't think of anything substantial to criticize it about but I also can't think of anything to deride it for. Sure, it could be funnier since it's a comedy but it was still entertaining even if the laughs didn't always hit.

film.filmname: Birds of Prey: And the Fantabulous Emancipation of One Harley Quinn (2020)
film.summary: After splitting with the Joker, Harley Quinn joins superheroes Black Canary, Huntress and Renee Montoya to save a young girl from an evil crime lord.
film.quote: While not written by the same writer as Suicide Squad, it suffers from some of the same issues, though not nearly as badly; most notably, Robbie is great as Quinn but the material just doesn't give her enough good stuff to work with. It comes across more as corny than anything else more than I would have liked. But it was still a fun enough film, just really insubstantial and unmemorable. Okay action, some decent jokes, underused secondary characters. Deserves better.

film.summary: This film focuses on a Burmese refugee whose fate has linked him to the lives of two Thai women in a border town. (Kick the Machine)
film.quote: Really the only Weerasethakul movie I found boring. It's not that it doesn't have merits... it's beautiful like his films always are. This just didn't do it for me. Not a bad movie, as I said it's still well made, and that's why it's got a 65.

film.summary: Two Irish brothers accidentally killed mafia thugs. They turned themselves in and were released as heroes. They then see it as a calling by God and started knocking off mafia gang members one by one. Willem Dafoe plays the detective trying to figure out the killings, but the closer he was to catching the Irish brothers, the more he thinks the brothers are doing the right thing. (imdb)

Born Villain is a short film directed by actor Shia LaBeouf in collaboration with Marilyn Manson. It was released on August 28, 2011, during its inaugural screening, at the L.A. Silent Theater. Produced as an accompaniment to Marilyn Manson's eighth studio album, the film was intended as the record's promotional &quot;trailer&quot;. (Youtube)
film.quote: A mixture of Manson and Jodorowsky, clearly. While this doesn't really help lend Labeouf his own identity (just like Maniac didn't), it's still well done. It has odd, disturbing imagery, and it really isn't clear what's going on. Not really a fan of the Manson song... he's pretty much past his &quot;prime.&quot; But the video was well done and Shia's directed stuff seems more out there than the stuff he acts in, not that he isn't in some stuff with interesting ideas.

film.summary: The mysterious disappearance of a young woman leads her boyfriend on a journey for truth and perhaps his own unknown reality in this dark, hypnotic mystery that transcends the limitations of traditional narrative. (imdb)
film.quote: The first act or so set up a nice little horror film with good atmosphere and a real sense of foreboding. There's a sense of surrealist style here that makes everything feel otherworldly but interesting. However, it gets worse from that point, and while never coming off the rails by any means, it ends up being a little more average/expected than it should have been. Decent acting, except for the masked man who not only has ridiculous dialogue but delivers it in a silly, over the top way.

film.summary: Famed documentarian Michael Moore returns with his first feature film in five years, as he tackles the issue of America&#039;s unique obsession with firearms.
film.quote: It's an entertaining movie but it fails as a documentary due to his blatant manipulations to make his point. I don't mind some bias since we all have it, but this is taken to the extreme and the movie suffers because of it.

film.summary: A woman living in New York takes control of her life- one block at a time. (imdb)
film.quote: It's fine. I guess the highlight here is Jillian Bell, who up until this movie never really impressed me. It's not that she was ever bad, she was just kind of there. This was a good performance. Aside from that, it has positive messages which is nice, and it takes a few little turns, but it just kind of ran its course. Never bad, never great, entertaining regardless.

film.summary: Bruce is a local news reporter who is discontented with nearly everything in his life, and rarely misses an opportunity to complain about it. Until one day God endows Bruce with all of his powers and challenges him to take on his job and see if he can do any better. (Universal Pictures)
Two brothers named Jamar and Suwo came back to the land of Java to avenge their father, who was a Sultan, after years of exile in America. (imdb)
film.quote: Pretty good action though given some of the other movies in this genre that come out of Indonesia it's rather pedestrian. It's fun, has a little bit of emotional depth. Doesn't go above and beyond in any shape or form.

film.summary: Hanks stars as Chuck Noland, a FedEx systems engineer whose personal and professional life are ruled by the clock. His manic existence abruptly ends when, after a plane crash, he becomes isolated on a remote island - cast away into the most desolate environment imaginable. (Twentieth Century Fox)
A group of teenagers encourage each other's bad behavior.
film.quote: Not a bad film. I didn't know that the movie was gonna be like this... somewhere I read it was a comedy. Jokes on me. Anyway, the choice to make the internet physical was a great one, and so the movie had some nice cinematography. I like the look into the seedy part of the internet, though the movie could have used some more work in a bunch of different ways. Still, an interesting idea about a good subject... the idea may turn off people who LOLZ INTERNET.

film.summary: In 2027, in a chaotic world in which women have become somehow infertile, a former activist agrees to help transport a miraculously pregnant woman to a sanctuary at sea.
film.quote: While the long tracking part at the end is fantastic, and this movie is well made, I failed to get emotionally invested in anything that was going on.

film.summary: A doctor hires an escort to seduce her husband, whom she suspects of cheating, though unforeseen events put the family in danger (imdb)
film.quote: I'm given props to a few things. The trio of actors (I think Moore gives the best performance, really.. but she's pretty underrated in general), and the music. There are some really inspired scenes, and the movie never bored me. I felt that some scenes were a little silly and I didn't really like the ending. But it does do a good job mostly at examining these characters. I flip flopped on 65 (pretty high end good) or 70 (very good). Some moments of weakness but all in all, good stuff.

film.summary: The mortal son of the god Zeus embarks on a perilous journey to stop the underworld and its minions from spreading their evil to Earth as well as the heavens.
film.quote: It was a lot of fun! I pretty much got what I expected and I'm happy with that. The monster designs are awesome, and there are a few really good scenes that made me go yeeeeees! The ending was bullshit, though.

film.summary: Birth and death are extraordinary experiences. Life is a fleeting pleasure. (imdb)
film.quote: I respect what he was going for here. The colour palette is dingy and hellish, the camera work is kinetic and adds to the chaos. Music is memorable, choreography of the dancing is great. Technically this is on point. But on a personal level, I didn't care that much for all the dancing, and when things go awry the pacing eventually shit the bed and I realized I was just waiting for the trip to end. Went from feeling uncomfortable (the intent) to a little bored (not the intent).

film.summary: A picture-perfect family is shattered when the work of a serial killer hits too close to home. Dylan McDermott stars in this chilling portrait of all-American evil. (imdb)
film.quote: It's pretty good, nothing exceptional. Like others have said it loses its way in the final act with flashbacks, mostly because a) there's no tension in them and b) they aren't necessary. We got it without being explicitly shown. It's also predictable, trying a swerve fairly early on but then going back on track with what we expected. But despite my criticisms I'm not going to act like I didn't enjoy it because the premise is undoubtedly tragic and it's mostly handled well.

film.summary: A woman discovers that severe catastrophic events are somehow connected to the mental breakdown from which she's suffering. (imdb)
film.quote: I'm really conflicted. We should support fun and original ideas like this, either way. Supposedly a dark comedy, I didn't see many jokes, unless bad running is a joke (in which case, nice). One of the impactful parts near the end came across as a little silly to me, which was going against the tone. The shift to something more serious was fine at the end though. Go see it, it just didn't click with me as much as it could have. I may rethink this later as well, I need more time to stew on it.

film.summary: A Korean-born man finds himself stuck in Columbus, Indiana, where his architect father is in a coma. The man meets a young woman who wants to stay in Columbus with her mother, a recovering addict, instead of pursuing her own dreams. (imdb)
film.quote: Is definitely like an Ozu movie in the way it transitions and establishes shots, but I don't think it's as good as the Ozu movies I've seen. It looks really good, I like the appreciation for architecture in it, but I was having a really hard time getting invested in these people. Some of the stuff they'd say came off as trying too hard, but there were some interesting conversations and it did get better as it went on... but it was too late at that point. A big of a slog.

film.filmname: A Complete History of My Sexual Failures (2008)
film.summary: Independent filmmaker Chris Waitt attempts to interview his ex-girlfriends to find out why they dumped him. This revealing and humorous documentary sees the slacker filmmaker go on a sexual and emotional odyssey in a desperate quest to solve his innumerable problems. (imdb)
film.quote: I'm like many others where I think part of it is fake. And I've looked around a bit on the net and don't know what to think. Oh well. So, if it's fake at all it kind of loses some appeal but even if it's completely real, it's not an amazing movie or anything. It's good. The ending is actually really genuine and memorable but some parts were just godawful.

film.summary: Concussion is a dramatic thriller based on the incredible true David vs. Goliath story of American immigrant Dr. Bennet Omalu, the brilliant forensic neuropathologist who made the first discovery of CTE, a football-related brain trauma, in a pro player and fought for the truth to be known. Omalu's emotional quest puts him at dangerous odds with one of the most powerful institutions in the world. (imdb)
film.quote: Will Smith does a wonderful job and it is a fairly gripping drama about an important subject. I didn't love it but I was entertained more than I should have been, considering I don't like football. Yes, I know it's about more than just a sport, but the consequences of said sport.

film.summary: Set in the distant future, Connected is a story about survival and greed with a post apocalyptic wasteland as its backdrop. Survivors of an unknown disaster shuffle through a desolate landscape, as it quickly becomes clear that not everybody has the strength to survive.
film.quote: Very solid because of great visuals mostly. However, even though there's literally no back story or dialogue, I felt the ending was still pretty powerful. Plus I enjoy the soundtrack. I'm also a sucker for post apocalyptic stuff, barren fields, dirty air, that kind of stuff.

film.summary: When a plane crashes in a small town, it releases a secret biological weapon. As the toxic substance infiltrates the local water system, some residents become gravely ill, while others descend into homicidal madness. The sheriff attempts to set things straight, but soon the military becomes involved in trying to contain the killer virus.
film.quote: Competent but not especially special. Not really much to add. There's little to complain about but little to praise. Entertaining, though.

film.summary: The last Gunslinger, Roland Deschain, has been locked in an eternal battle with Walter O'Dim, also known as the Man in Black, determined to prevent him from toppling the Dark Tower, which holds the universe together. With the fate of the worlds at stake, good and evil will collide in the ultimate battle as only Roland can defend the Tower from the Man in Black.
film.quote: I haven't read the books so I can't come at it from that angle. As just a movie it hits enough to be fine, but is flawed. It does come across as incredibly rushed; it would have been nice to see something more fleshed out. But it's not incoherent as it's very easy to understand. It's pretty thin, more depth would have been nice, especially with Roland and The Man in Black, but it's relatively stylish and entertaining. Everyone but the child were pretty good.

film.summary: Dawson City: Frozen Time, pieces together the bizarre true history of a collection of some 500 films dating from 1910s - 1920s, which were lost for over 50 years until being discovered buried in a sub-arctic swimming pool deep in the Yukon Territory, in Dawson City, located about 350 miles south of the Arctic Circle. (imdb)
film.quote: Music was really moody and complimentary towards the images on screen, the premise itself is extremely interesting, and seeing clips from some of these movies was interesting for the film nerds that would actually seek this out. Unfortunately, the way the info is presented (mostly in text) gets a little tedious and the story itself isn't told in the most effective and engaging way. It's unfortunate that I have to label this as a little boring because it should have been so neat.

film.summary: On a daredevil caving holiday six girls are trapped underground when an unexpected rock fall blocks their exit. Searching the maze of tunnels for a way out, they find themselves hunted by a race of fearless, hungry predators, once humanoid but now monstrously adapted to live in the dark and with murder and mayhem on their minds. (20th Century Fox)
film.quote: While it does succeed on creating an claustrophobic environment for its characters to go crazy in, I just didn't find this movie all that scary or daring. Still, it's not a horrible movie so it gets a recommendation.

film.summary: Four young men and a young woman sit in boredom. She smokes while one strums a lute, one looks at a magazine, and two fiddle with string. The door opens and in comes a young man, cigarette between his lips, a swagger on his face. The young woman laughs. As the four young men continue disconnected activities, the other two become a couple. When the four realize something has changed, first they stare at the couple who have kissed and now are dancing slowly...
film.quote: I enjoyed the soundtrack, the noise of it all didn't really bother me any. There are some good images here and there and the end was a little creepy.

film.summary: Based on a story by M. Night Shyamalan and directed by the brothers Dowdle (Quarantine helmers Drew and John Eric), this edgy thriller is set in an elevator, where a group of passengers are trapped with none other than the king of the underworld. Luckily for them, a homicide detective (Chris Messina) is on board. Not so luckily: the cop has issues of his own, including a not-so-long-ago-kicked addiction to alcohol.
film.quote: Not that it's the most amazing movie ever but I saw it getting shat on by a lot of people and I don't see the reason for hating it. Like I said, it's not amazing but it's a solid murder mystery.

film.summary: In the fall of 1960, Father Thomas Riley and Father John Thornton were sent by the Vatican to investigate a miraculous event in an Irish home for 'fallen women', only to uncover something much more horrific. (imdb)
film.quote: I wish it had done more with the premise, and it really stretches the found footage concept, but I like the format when it's done right, and despite the fact that it feels very familiar in a lot of ways, I enjoyed it. There was some good imagery here, decent dialogue and sense of style. The final act in the tunnels felt very uninspired so that hurt it, but up until that point I had it at a 70 or a 75. Still worth a watch for horror buffs even if it's unoriginal.

film.filmname: Di qiu zui hou de ye wan (2019)
film.summary: A man went back to Guizhou, found the tracks of a mysterious woman. He recalls the summer he spent with her twenty years ago. (imdb)
film.quote: I'm torn. It's a technical achievement but I'm not sure it was worth it. Sometimes when he just moved the camera along a wall with talking placed over it the movie felt dull. And like someone said, the long shot at the end is impressive but also kinda just felt like a long shot. There are moments where it's gorgeous and the narrative would be interesting if it wasn't limited by Bi Gan's directorial choices. I liked it, ultimately, and admire it in ways but I wanted more.

film.summary: In a city ravaged by violent crime, the police department&#039;s anti-gang task force uses any means at its disposal to get the bad guys off the streets, with cops often acting as judge, jury and executioner. AS the unit&#039;s self-justifying brutality and corruption spiral further out of control, gang member turned cop Armando Sancho (Collins Jr.) begins to question the life he and his partner (Gooding Jr.) have chosen. (Silver Nitrate)
film.quote: Ah, this was a solid movie. Sure, it's a bit of a rip-off but it was surprisingly entertaining and not so bad.

film.summary: Allied soldiers from Belgium, the British Empire, Canada, and France are surrounded by the German army and evacuated during a fierce battle in World War II. (imdb)
film.quote: It's better than Interstellar by a little bit because it doesn't really have anything that annoyed me. But I think Nolan is starting to lose me. His directorial sense is strong here; it looks beautiful, everything is framed wonderfully, he makes the environment interesting even if it's mostly water. His usage of loud sounds and unconventional music is great, lends it a sense of dread. But I felt cold, it was dry, a little boring, very little heart and the performances were only ok.

film.summary: A long series of unrelated images, revolving, often distorted: lights, flowers, nails. A lightboard... (imdb)
film.quote: Better than Le Retour à la raison, but I wasn't such a fan of that anyway. It was okay. This is more of the same though slightly better because it has a little more going on. I can admire it but don't overly enjoy it.

film.summary: Robert McCall serves an unflinching justice for the exploited and oppressed, but how far will he go when that is someone he loves?
film.quote: A Denzel action movie has to work especially hard for me to dislike it, so I still enjoyed this. It's a little better than the first one, but it still suffers from some of the same problems. The final act felt so forced, like they HAD to get it to a place where Denzel could use his surroundings to his advantage, but it felt abrupt. But besides that, a decent action movie and at least we got to see that Denzel intense face that I love.

film.summary: Robert McCall is a man who believes he has put his mysterious past behind him and dedicated himself to beginning a new, quiet life. But when he meets Teri, a young girl under the control of ultra-violent Russian gangsters, he can't stand idly by. He has to help her. (imdb)
film.quote: It was fun, but honestly the hardware store scene (where he never even picks up a gun) kinda got to me. I know it's nit-picky, but for some reason it bothered me. The attempt at "original" kills didn't have the same effect on me that it might have had on others. Still, Denzel is great, and it's always a little satisfying watching a movie like this. Stereotypical villains, slowmo explosions, lots of action... follows a formula, does it pretty okay.

film.summary: A climbing expedition on Mt. Everest is devastated by a severe snow storm. (imdb)
film.quote: Ultimately it's entertaining with a little bit of emotional engagement, especially with Hall's phone calls with his wife. Wonderful cinematography really brought the movie to life. It wasn't the greatest thing ever by any means but it was better than I thought it would be.

film.summary: Mr. Church reunites the Expendables for what should be an easy paycheck, but when one of their men is murdered on the job, their quest for revenge puts them deep in enemy territory and up against an unexpected threat. (imdb)
film.quote: While I absolutely loved the first one, I thought this one would be better because it just has more badass people. The first one was cheesy and so is this, only I don't think the cheese works as much. It seems way too forced. It's not that it's bad by any means, it's an entertaining enough action flick with a great beginning and end, but some of it just felt ridiculous (not in a good way), like the Norris entry. I felt like the first did everything better. I'm prolly alone in this.

film.summary: Joel, the owner of an Extract plant, tries to contend with myriad personal and professional problems, such as his potentially unfaithful wife and employees who want to take advantage of him.
film.quote: "I'll be the laughing stock of the grindcore community." I loved that line. But there were very few parts that I actually laughed. The plotline is dull. The acting is definitely passable and all that. It's a decent movie, and pretty clever, but it's not really a good movie. Pretty close though.

film.summary: Michael Moore's "Fahrenheit 11/9" is a provocative and comedic look at the times in which we live. It will explore the two most important questions of the Trump Era: How the f**k did we get here, and how the f**k do we get out?
film.quote: It's important to consider how Moore manipulates things in order to make his points. Usually he is entertaining and treats documentaries more as an angry call to arms than an even look at a situation. I'm okay with that, but this feels like a mess. There are times he's so right on, I learned some things, but then this felt so unconnected a lot of the time... or if it is, it's a very loose connection. I didn't like this as much as most of his other movies I've seen.

film.summary: A Chinese family discover their grandmother has only a short while left to live and decide to keep her in the dark, scheduling a wedding to gather before she dies.
film.quote: For someone who is only vaguely familiar with some Eastern perspectives, this was a novel take on a family drama. There are certainly scenes/moments that I love here, and I don't begrudge any of the actors for the fact that I wasn't that entertained most of the time. And that was the problem: when the emotional parts hit they hit hard, and I love the honesty here, but as just a movie I wasn't that into it.

film.summary: Capturing life on the Italian island of Lampedusa, a frontline in the European migrant crisis. (imdb)
film.quote: A tale of two movies. One is a dull life of a kid (and his family) doing dull stuff like firing a slingshot and getting his eyes checked. It's so mundane that it hurts. The other movie is the gripping story of migrants who suffer trying to cross an ocean to escape tragedies. This part is painful and effective. I do respect what Rosi has done, however, with excellent direction. Unlike other docs, there's nothing to really sway you; the distinct lack of music (unless naturally there) is important.

film.summary: A veteran grifter takes a young, attractive woman under his wing, but things get complicated when they become romantically involved. (imdb)
film.quote: It's entertaining, but a little predictable. Robbie and Smith have good chemistry, both of them being charming. The plot doesn't unfold in any deep, meaningful way, but hey, it's a pretty funny romantic comedy about con artists.

film.summary: American car designer Carroll Shelby and driver Ken Miles battle corporate interference, the laws of physics and their own personal demons to build a revolutionary race car for Ford and challenge Ferrari at the 24 Hours of Le Mans in 1966.
film.quote: Rating this a 65 mostly comes down to the fact that I don't give a shit about cars but wanted to watch this because I was down for some Bale and Damon action. They really could have cut some of this down to get better pacing, but for the most part it's a solid drama with good performances. If I was more interested in the premise I would have liked this more for sure. Even I have to begrudgingly admit that the racing was kinda fun.

film.summary: Driving cross-country, Ray and his wife and daughter stop at a highway rest area where his daughter falls and breaks her arm. After a frantic rush to the hospital and a clash with the check-in nurse, Ray is finally able to get her to a doctor. While the wife and daughter go downstairs for an MRI, Ray, exhausted, passes out in a chair in the lobby. Upon waking up, they have no record or knowledge of Ray's family ever being checked in.
film.quote: It doesn't really maintain the tension required to represent this type of movie, but it was still an entertaining ride. This was despite the fact that it was predictable, which these types of movies shouldn't be. Anderson has done a lot better than this though.

film.summary: A tale of a boy trapped in an abandoned fridge at the back of a housing estate and the attempts of an alcoholic couple to free him. (Cinema16.org)
film.quote: While I like it and there are definitely some compelling and intense parts, and I give props to the music that is simple, yet beautiful... sometimes I just feel like the tone is all messed up. I'm all for adding conflicting tones and whatnot in movies, to make a point (see something like, a Korine film), but I don't feel like Mullan was attempting that here. So some parts don't gel well with the rest of the film, but the parts that do -- which, honestly, is most of them -- are good stuff.

film.summary: Friends with Kids revolves around a pair of best friends in their 30s who observe the effect of having kids has taken on the couples they know. To avoid that toll, the best friends resolve to have a child and then date other people.
film.quote: Quite by the numbers. It'd be nice to see more rom-coms that try to innovate the genre but I mean, this kind of thing is what the main audience wants, not overly critical people like us. They want two people who should be together to get together. Cue some drama, and then it happens. Though I didn't find the movie funny and the drama was only okay. The acting was fine, the script brought up some nice issues about relationships. Ultimately forgettable but not bad in the least.

film.summary: This update of the 1985 horror comedy focuses more on terror than laughs when teen Charley Brewster (Anton Yelchin) suspects that his new neighbor, the sinister Jerry Dandrige (Colin Farrell), is a vampire, and turns to a self-styled vampire expert, Peter Vincent (David Tennant), for help. Las Vegas magician Vincent proves useless, and it's up to Charley to save his mom, Judy (Toni Collette), and girlfriend, Amy, from the seductive bloodsucker.
film.quote: Yeah, it's good. It's tongue-in-cheek in ways and I suppose that makes it a bit satirical, but it's still a vampire movie, which -- at this point -- takes a lot more to impress me. It's solid and a decent time, but really nothing more than that. Everything is competent, though I don't feel like it was that funny.

film.summary: Based on a popular graphic novel, From Hell puts an intense psychological spin on the horrific legend of Jack the Ripper and unravels a chilling alleged conspiracy involving the highest powers in England. (Twentieth Century Fox)

A heinous crime tests the complex relationship between a tenacious personal assistant and her Hollywood starlet boss. As the assistant unravels the mystery, she must confront her own understanding of friendship, truth, and celebrity. (imdb)
film.quote: Entertaining, murder mysteries are generally fun until they aren't. It all comes down to the resolution and this didn't have one that will blow minds exactly, but the execution of it as a whole is pretty solid; the electropop and moody atmosphere helps, certainly.

film.summary: As Johnny Blaze hides out in Eastern Europe, he is called upon to stop the devil, who is trying to take human form. (imdb)
film.quote: One of the only pleasures I get in this world is watching Nic Cage act crazy. And he does not disappoint here. This movie is silly, campy, cheesy and occasionally dark, and it's better for it. It's batshit insane. While some things were wonky, I mostly had a good time here. It was fun and mindless with cool action.

film.summary: Eighteen-year-old Matthew Kidman (Hirsch) is a straight-arrow over-achiever who has never really lived life, until he falls for his new neighbor, the beautiful and seemingly innocent Danielle (Cuthbert). When Matthew discovers this perfect &#034;girl next door&#034; is a one-time porn star, his sheltered existence begins to spin out of control. (20th Century Fox)
Three retirees plan a bank heist. (imdb)
film.quote: Nothin' wrong with this, nothin' great about this outside of the chemistry between Freeman, Caine and Arkin. Seriously, the script was pretty good and funny as a whole, but because they put 3 great actors together it put it up a notch. I mean, as I said coming out, I don't LOVE it but I certainly enjoyed it... and sometimes that's all you need.

film.filmname: A Good Day to Die Hard (2013)
film.summary: John McClane travels to Russia to help out his seemingly wayward son, Jack, only to discover that Jack is a CIA operative working to prevent a nuclear-weapons heist, causing the father and son to team up against underworld forces. (imdb)
film.quote: Nah td888, you aren't the only one who enjoyed it. While Die Hard has certainly "lost its way," and it is certainly illogical, I don't even care because it's a Hollywood action movie. Things blew up and Brucey murdered dudes. Yes, some of it is STUPID and I certainly mentally rolled my eyes (cuz rolling eyes physically is for losers!), I still ultimately had a good time. Die Hard will never be like the first few, but they don't have to be (tho it'd be nice). Just entertain me.

film.summary: A college student relives the day of her murder with both its unexceptional details and terrifying end until she discovers her killer's identity.
film.quote: It's fun, I don't see the glaring issues that others here seem to. I don't even think this was meant to be a horror movie. It certainly is set up like one and occasionally acts like one, but you can tell the director thinks it's a little silly and acts on that, leading to some upbeat montages and ridiculous deaths. My problem is that I don't think it went far enough into silly territory. It does everything... okay. Would have given it a 70 if the plot twist wasn't so predictable.

film.summary: A cat-and-mouse psychotic thriller as incisive as it is stylish, Hard Candy delivers a provocative take on the revenge drama while jangling nerves at every turn. The film plunges us into an unstable universe where we cannot readily identify the "good guy" in the tense confrontation between a 14-year-old girl and the 32-year-old man she suspects of pedophilia and murder. (Lionsgate)
film.quote: While Ellen Page does what she can with the material, there isn't a lot in terms of material here.

film.summary: Turo (25) is trying to overcome his fears by leading the most unknown heavy metal band in Finland, Impaled Rektum, to the hottest metal festival of Norway. The journey includes heavy metal, grave robbing, Viking heaven and an armed conflict between Finland and Norway. (imdb)
film.quote: Since metal isn't that represented it's always nice to see a movie about it. If you understand the clichés and tropes of metal then there are some good jokes here, but they are few and far between. It doesn't really hit satisfying emotional depths and since there isn't a lot of comedy to bail it out it ends up being a pretty fun but ultimately insubstantial little flick about a culture that your average person doesn't care to indulge in.

film.summary: A gun-for-hire known only as Agent 47 is ensnared in a political conspiracy, which finds him pursued by both Interpol and the Russian military as he treks across Eastern Europe. hired by a group known as "The Agency" to kill targets for cash.
film.quote: Maybe it's because I needed to be cheered up after watching Cries and Whispers, but I enjoyed this. It's not exactly high art or even that faithful to the game, but it's worth a watch if you want something mindless.

film.summary: Set in riot-torn, near-future Los Angeles, 'Hotel Artemis' follows the Nurse, who runs a secret, members-only emergency room for criminals. (imdb)
film.quote: Like many others I think the premise is really cool but this whole movie feels underdeveloped. It would have worked well as a TV show where they could have fleshed it out, or even a longer movie. Interesting ideas are in here, and I thought it was a 70 until the end when everything seemed to resolve too quickly. With that said, the end did have a fun action sequence in a hallway that felt fairly raw. But ultimately, it's a film that should have reached for more. Still entertaining.

film.filmname: I Don't Feel at Home in This World Anymore (2017)
film.summary: When a depressed woman is burglarized, she finds a new sense of purpose by tracking down the thieves alongside her obnoxious neighbor. But they soon find themselves dangerously out of their depth against a pack of degenerate criminals. (imdb)
film.quote: There are certainly moments I enjoyed here, like recovering the laptop or the conversation Lynskey has with her pursuer at the end, and some of the violence worked for me because it was abrupt and loud, like this kind of violence should be. But in between these parts beat the heart of a fairly dull movie. The humour rarely clicked with me despite their best efforts. Good performances by Wood and Lynskey, also a good sense of atmosphere and directorial prowess for Blair/the cinematographer.

film.summary: Mia Hall thought the hardest decision she would ever face would be whether to pursue her musical dreams at Juilliard or follow a different path to be with the love of her life, Adam. But what should have been a carefree family drive changes everything in an instant, and now her own life hangs in the balance. Caught between life and death for one revealing day, Mia has only one decision left, which will not only decide her future but her ultimate fate. (imdb)
film.quote: Watch Chloe's ghost eerily creep up on people who think they're having a private moment. Seriously though, it's very sappy. However, I've always maintained that there's nothing wrong with a tearjerker and I'm not sure why melodrama is seen as bad by default for some people. There is some hokey stuff scattered throughout, and the spirit stuff is a little silly a times, but it's pretty good at what it does. Chloe is instantly likeable and god damn that crushing scene with Keach.

film.summary: A U.S. Customs official uncovers a money laundering scheme involving Colombian drug lord Pablo Escobar.
film.quote: It kind of takes a while to get going but by the end of it I actually felt for the characters and the relationships that Cranston's character cultivated throughout. The plot is written well enough. Doesn't do anything especially fantastic, nor does it do anything poorly. Cranston is one in a fairly small group of actors who can do nice one second and then absolutely terrifying the next, though I wouldn't say this role is award worthy or anything.

film.summary: 70-year-old widower Ben Whittaker has discovered that retirement isn't all it's cracked up to be. Seizing an opportunity to get back in the game, he becomes a senior intern at an online fashion site, founded and run by Jules Ostin. (imdb)
film.quote: I liked it. It was kinda funny and didn't rely so much on 'LOOK AT YOUNG PEOPLE AND INSTAGRAM' as poorly as some other films do. Had some decent jokes for sure. The drama was mostly effective, though the way this handled its subject matter (gender politics, old vs young) was not in the least bit subtle, in both the dialogue and the way the scenes were staged. De Niro and Hathaway are good together. The script flirted with flipping conventions around but ended in a Hollywood way.

film.summary: An elite hitman returns to erase his past only to find that somebody has messed with his future. (imdb)
film.quote: This movie rests almost entirely on Goss and his performance. He does a really good job of playing a mostly cold-blooded Hitman. But the rest of the movie just needs work. I understand that the budget probably wasn't real high, but the sound mixing is terrible, the script is pretty thin, and some of the acting is really bad. The events aren't told the best. However, the climax did make me a bit emotional, and all-in-all, it was an entertaining movie. Touch it up, and it becomes easily an 80.

film.summary: A homicide investigator digs deeper into a case involving a trained military sniper who shot five random victims. Based on a book in Lee Child's crime series. (imdb)
film.quote: I enjoy movies about badasses, sometimes this went a little over-the-top in establishing that, but that was a minor, forgivable offense. This dragged, even though the story was interesting enough, I felt that the pacing was off. However, the fight scenes were pretty awesome, I just wish there were more of them. Herzog is always going to Herzog which means he's always going to be great. The final action sequence was a little disappointing.

film.summary: Jack Ryan, as a young covert CIA analyst, uncovers a Russian plot to crash the U.S. economy with a terrorist attack. (imdb)
film.quote: It's pretty good. I think it's about what I expected, not what I hoped -- a fun, reasonably thrilling thriller, nothing overly memorable but something I'd watch a sequel of to pass some easy time. At times it feels more like the first Mission: Impossible than the MIs afterward, which is nice, because it adds some mystery and suspense, and doesn't rely on action all the time.

film.summary: Johnny Knoxville -- the original Jackass himself -- returns after a long hiatus and subjects himself to all-new stunts involving wild animals, dangerous heights and other perils guaranteed to do him bodily harm. "Jackass" regulars Bam Margera and Steve-O also endure their share of punishment in this collection of stomach-churning, don't-ever-try-these-at-home acrobatics that time and again blur the line between hilarious and tasteless.
film.quote: Clever social commentary.

film.summary: A newly possessed cheerleader turns into a killer who specializes in offing her male classmates.
film.quote: Am I the only one who sees this movie as a big, elaborate criticism of indie rock bands? Probably. Oh well. I enjoyed the movie. It was entertaining, campy, kinda sexy, with some capable cinematography (some nice shots like when the goth kid goes to meet Megan Fox... the street looked nice and properlys cary). Some of the dialogue was awful and Cody's style fit more with Juno but still, entertaining flick. Not amazing but well enjoyable.

film.summary: A neo-noir revenge thriller centering on Julia Shames, who after suffering a brutal trauma, falls prey to an unorthodox form of therapy to restore herself. (imdb)
film.quote: Has a sense of style without being flashy. Williams was wonderful in the main role despite the director wanting her to stare off into the distance way too often in order to show her pain. Killings lacked significant oomph and the psychological aspects weren't explored enough. The script also needs some tidying up. But despite the problems, I enjoyed myself. I'm also just a fan of the genre, however, and would never recommend this as a shining example of it. A good time, though.

film.summary: When his mentor is taken captive, a retired member of Britain's Elite Special Air Service is forced into action. His mission: kill three assassins dispatched by their cunning leader.
film.quote: I've said I haven't been a huge fan of Statham's action movies but I've liked a few, and this is one. I don't love 'em, but I do think he's a great action star who doesn't pick the best of movies. But enough of that... it's pretty clever, has an interesting subject matter, but it's all about the action, and some of the action is pretty cool. Clive Owen, Statham, De Niro... it could have been amazing but hell, it's fun, I'll take it.

film.summary: An ex-convict and his brother are forced on the run by a vengeful criminal. (imdb)
film.quote: A solid sci-fi flick that unfortunately probably won't be getting the sequel that it needs to explore the pretty cool stuff it sets up. It dragged a little bit at times and there were some serious leaps in logic that felt forced in to create drama, but there was some heart here, the visual effects were cool, there were some good jokes, Kravitz has a delightful smile (not creepy, right???) and the action was passable.

film.summary: After spending years in California, Amir returns to his homeland in Afghanistan to help his old friend Hassan, whose son is in trouble. (imdb)
film.quote: It was one of those movies that I'd see if someone paid but I won't rent or download it. But it was above average and although some of it was predictable, it still told the story well and had some emotion in it. Mild recommendation.

film.summary: During an unfortunate series of events a friend of Kung Fury is assassinated by the most dangerous kung fu master criminal of all time; Adolf Hitler, a.k.a Kung Führer. Kung Fury decides to travel back in time, to Nazi Germany, in order to kill Hitler and end the Nazi empire once and for all. (imdb)
film.quote: I enjoy it but I'm not getting the hype for it. The visual effects are great, the soundtrack is nice, the action is ridiculous and entertaining, and it's funny sometimes, but it just couldn't grab me like it should. Was it just too random? Maybe they didn't play it straight enough? There's almost too much winking at the camera but it's still a fun example of schlocky crap. I think I'm just kind of over a few of the things the net still loves, like Hitler appearing in everything.

film.filmname: The Last House on the Left (2009)
film.summary: After kidnapping and butchering two teenagers, a gang unknowingly finds refuge with the parents of one of the victims -- hosts who devise gruesome revenge.
film.quote: I stopped seeing this as a horror flick and more as a revenge flick. That's not to say that there wasn't some suspense because there was, and there was some decent horror because of that. This movie doesn't rely on cheap jump scare tactics nearly as much as a lot of modern movies. It's not really that scary in general but it's an entertaining flick that has some OH HELL YES moments. A bit of surprise for me.

film.summary: The paths of two warriors converge when the Emperor of Japan hires a Civil War veteran to train Japan's first modern army. As he encounters the Samurai traditions, the troubled American soldier finds himself at the center of a violent and epic struggle between two eras and two worlds, with only his sense of honor to guide him.
film.quote: It just kind of exists. It's not bad, it's not good. I wouldn't mind watching it again but I won't seek it out.

film.summary: In London for the Prime Minister's funeral, Mike Banning discovers a plot to assassinate all the attending world leaders. (imdb)
film.quote: I might as well be honest, I liked it, just like I enjoyed Olympus Has Fallen. The script sucks, though some of the humour worked, and most of the cast is misused (Butler is fine in this role). There's blatant xenophobia and Jingoism, but I'm more forgiving of that. Ultimately, it's just an action movie, and it takes more for action movies to leave me feeling like I wasted my time/money. It's fun and stupid, I had a good time.

film.filmname: A Man Walks Into a Bar (2013)
film.summary: After an awkward exchange, two strangers realize that picking up a member of the opposite sex can be a tricky business. (imdb)
film.quote: Oh so this is what Rhys does when he isn't purging. Anyway, this isn't bad, I chuckled once or twice, and it has a fun little premise.

film.summary: A family learns important life lessons from their adorable, but naughty and neurotic dog.
film.quote: I thought it was really sad. So what? Wanna fight about it?

film.summary: During a manned mission to Mars, Astronaut Mark Watney is presumed dead after a fierce storm and left behind by his crew. But Watney has survived and finds himself stranded and alone on the hostile planet. With only meager supplies, he must draw upon his ingenuity, wit and spirit to subsist and find a way to signal to Earth that he is alive. (imdb)
film.quote: I enjoyed the science and a bunch of the jokes worked (some were really forced), but I had a hard time with this one. It wasn't bad by any means, but it felt too lighthearted to the point that I never felt any risk, and I didn't sense any chemistry among the actors (even though it's a great cast). Competently shot but unremarkable, I'm destined to be the contrarian with this one.

film.summary: The human city of Zion defends itself against the massive invasion of the machines as Neo fights to end the war at another front while also opposing the rogue Agent Smith.
film.quote: It doesn't hold a candle to the first or even the second but it's still entertaining enough to give a mild recommendation too.

film.summary: After escaping an attack by what he claims was by a 70-foot shark, Jonas Taylor must confront his fears to save those trapped in a sunken submersible.
film.quote: The problems are that the beach scene didn't have nearly enough death and that tonally it's confused. A few good laughs, a little bit of emotional depth, Statham is fun as per usual. The scene that's in the trailer where the kid sees the Meg close-up is framed/shot so well though... I love it. Ultimately it's almost a GOOD movie, but I'll take it for what it is and will watch the sequel(s).

film.summary: The true story of Marine Corporal Megan Leavey, who forms a powerful bond with an aggressive combat dog... (imdb)
film.quote: Considerably less interested in the actual war stuff because it's yet another American war story, so I'll just avoid commenting on the actual subject matter there. Instead, I'm more interested in the bond between Mara and Rex, which rings true for any animal lover regardless of their position in life. So in that sense, the second half or so is incredibly touching and relatable. Might take some cheap paths to get there but it gets there so I won't lie and say it didn't make me emotional.

film.summary: Marital infidelity, religion, a guy in heaven wearing a Wizards jersey, anal fetishes, cigarettes and schizophrenia, ghosts, and how it's going to get worse before it gets better.
film.quote: Really simple concept with convincing acting. It's terribly short and I'm not sure if that's a blessing or a curse. Do you like people sitting around and talking? Well that's what this is. I liked it. I don't think it's even close to being necessary viewing but it's pure film making, anyway.

film.summary: As thirty-something divorced pre-school teacher Sarah Nolan (Lane) braves a series of hilariously disastrous mismatches and first dates, she begins to trust her own instincts again and learns that, no matter what, it&#039;s never a good idea to give up on love. (Warner Bros.)
film.quote: Mainly 'cuz I'd mate with Cusack. However, despite my seemingly not-so-hetero-yet-still-hetero love for him, this is a pretty solid movie.

film.summary: Vada Sultenfuss is obsessed with death. Her mother is dead, and her father runs a funeral parlor. She is also in love with her English teacher... (imdb)
film.quote: I'm not going to watch this again because I don't want to taint my original opinion of the movie: This shit is sad.

film.summary: A high school senior finds herself immersed in an online game of truth or dare, where her every move starts to become manipulated by an anonymous community of "watchers." (imdb)
film.quote: A surprisingly entertaining and stylish thriller about the dangers of attention seekers and social media. The two leads were good together, and despite the logistics of the game Nerve (seriously, you have to suspend your disbelief hard), it was exciting to anticipate the "why" of its existence. Ultimately, the ending falls flat because the why is not that exciting and it wraps up way too neatly, but I enjoyed myself as a whole.

film.summary: Angela Bennett&#039;s a software engineer type who works from home and has few friends outside of cyberspace... (imdb)
In the dreams of his victims, a spectral child murderer stalks the children of the members of the lynch mob that killed him.
film.quote: I'm not huge on it, but I do remember turning on the TV late at night when I was a kid (I couldn't sleep) and seeing the famous Depp part. Scared the shit out of me. That counts for something. But when I came back and re-watched it... it's good, I don't love it.

film.summary: An air marshal springs into action during a transatlantic flight after receiving a series of text messages demanding $150 million into an off-shore account, or someone will die every 20 minutes.
film.quote: Despite any wonkiness that exists -- and believe me there is some head-scratching to be had here -- I had a good time. It maintained its mystery pretty well until the end. Neeson kicks some ass and that's usually entertaining. Not incredible, but a sometimes silly, sometimes intense suspense/thriller that is worth watching if you just wanna kill a little time with something that isn't mindblowing but is still satisfying.

film.summary: A former black ops agent and the young woman he's assigned to protect fight for survival after a surprise attack.
film.quote: Fun way to pass some time. Malin is cute as almost always, and I do enjoy Cusack. It's another by-the-numbers flick, where enemies lay siege to a building and the hero has to save the day, but oh he's cold and damaged, but this girl is more positive and shit. Was I entertained? Yeah, I was. Was I surprised at all? Nope. Text book movie, but you know that's not always a bad thing.

film.summary: Disgraced former Presidential guard Mike Banning finds himself trapped inside the White House in the wake of a terrorist attack; using his inside knowledge, Banning works with national security to rescue the President from his kidnappers. (imdb)
film.quote: It's been done a million times but it's still entertaining. While I understand that the Americanism of it all may turn off some, if you're an action movie fan you're going to see this type of movie a million more times so you might as well get used to it. Die hard in the White House, it's still a good time but obviously it isn't as good as Die Hard.

film.summary: A poker-playing restaurateur and former traveling salesman befriends a group of refugees newly arrived from Finland. (imdb)
film.quote: I'm not sure how I feel about the deadpan delivery here. Sometimes it really works, but it may have caused a slight disconnect for me that didn't allow me to enjoy this like others did. It looks nice, the mood is right on, the comedy only occasionally works and whatever drama is there was insubstantial. I guess the reason I don't think it's great is that while it is technically quite good, it didn't succeed as a dramedy.

film.summary: An epic set in post-WWII Japan and centered on an American former G.I. who joins the yakuza. (imdb)
film.quote: It's pretty good. It doesn't do a whole lot with the genre but I have a bias towards the Yakuza (they're my favourite mafia). I think the main character should have been someone other than Leto. I wasn't bored and there were a few scenes that I thought were genuinely great.

film.summary: Jake Pentecost, son of Stacker Pentecost, reunites with Mako Mori to lead a new generation of Jaeger pilots, including rival Lambert and 15-year-old hacker Amara, against a new Kaiju threat. (imdb)
film.quote: A significant drop from the first one. While the first had some really cool moments (some of which still stick in my mind and I have a terrible memory), this doesn't really have that. It's never bad, and watching giant robots and giant monsters is a good time, but the action is uninspired compared to the original. With Del Toro it was a clear passion project and you could feel it; DeKnight has made what basically amounts to a pretty fun action movie.

film.summary: A prisoner detained on a remote island plots his escape. A remake of the 1973 film 'Papillon'.' (imdb)
film.quote: Very slow but not boring, shot well, Hunnam puts in solid work. It's interesting seeing how the relationship between Malek and Hunnam's character develops and it paid off at the end. It doesn't really bring anything fresh to the table, but if you like prison dramas then it's definitely worth a watch.

film.summary: Paradise Now is the story of two young Palestinian men as they embark upon what may be the last 48 hours of their lives. (Warner Independent Pictures)
In 1988, young sisters Katie and Kristi befriend an invisible entity who resides in their home. (imdb)
film.quote: Probably would have been about as good as the second if it wasn't for the godawful ending and stupid twist. It's hard to deny that the formula is over staying its welcome a bit, but at the same time... at least the film makers get that sometimes it's what doesn't happen that's scary. That's pretty much the premise of these movies. Still, this can be tense, and enjoyable, and scary, and I loved the first one. Just please, don't make anymore. It's unnecessary.

film.summary: Peppermint is a revenge story centering on a young mother who finds herself with nothing to lose, and is now going to take from her enemies the very life they stole from her. (imdb)
film.quote: Revenge stories are almost always fun, and the formula to get a decent one is simple. This hits that formula enough to entertain me but it is basic and brings nothing new to the table. The action sequences are okay but in the better examples of the genre they are more thrilling. The hard rock violence music is bad, and Garner tries but it's hard for me to believe her in that role. And yet despite the obvious flaws I was never bored and I'd watch the sequel.

film.summary: A man tries to buy kiddie porn. (Myself)
film.quote: Funny, but not that funny. Like Michael C. Hall though.

film.summary: Retired black-ops CIA agent Frank Moses reunites his unlikely team of elite operatives for a global quest to track down a missing portable nuclear device. (imdb)
film.quote: I loved the first one. I thought that the first one was incredibly funny, everyone did a great job and the action was on point. The sequel seems more dry and not as funny, as I only laughed a couple times, the action is fine but not amazing and the cast does a good job but they don't really have as much to work with this time around. But still, it was an entertaining action comedy.

film.summary: After suffering a near fatal head injury, a young cowboy undertakes a search for new identity and what it means to be a man in the heartland of America. (imdb)
film.quote: The best parts are when Brady interacts with his sister and his disabled friend Lane. They felt warm and authentic, sometimes sad. Zhao puts in completely solid work here on the directorial front, the cinematography and music/sound design are definitely stand-outs. But as Pratchett3 said, the untrained actors delivered lines poorly... too often to be able to brush off. Brady was decent in a first performance but there were a lot of times his inexperience showed, which crippled scenes.

film.summary: Two Veteran New York City Detectives hunt a vigilante who may be one of their own.
film.quote: Pacino and DeNiro together makes this interesting. It isn't a horrible movie besides them, but they definitely elevate it to the point that it can be recommended. Without them, it'd be a rather generic crime drama.

film.summary: Despite his conviction that demonic possession is just so much supersitious mumbo jumbo, Catholic priest-in-training Michael Kovak (Colin O'Donoghue) journeys to Rome to attend a special exorcism school being taught at the Vatican. Before long, true-believer Father Lucas (Anthony Hopkins) introduces the young cleric to the devil's power firsthand.
film.quote: I enjoyed the whole, dude is confused about his faith angle, and how other characters talk about it. The rest of the movie was solid in pretty much every way, though not anything extravagant and overly memorable. A horror flick that's at the high end of good but not very good. I also like seeing Ciarán Hinds.

film.summary: A group of college friends reunite for a trip to the forest, but encounter a menacing presence in the woods that's stalking them. (imdb)
film.quote: It's way too dark for a lot of it. Apparently not just my TV since others had the same issue. It's predictable, uses a lot of the same tropes that so many horror movies use, the cast was okay and the relationships were somewhat interesting, though very surface-level. However, still entertained it, like the woods as a setting regardless, and the monster was awesome. Some hokey parts, ending resolution was a little too simple, some dumb shit happens, but a decent horror flick.

film.summary: Josh and Tiffany have been together since they were kids. ENTER Beth, a sexy blonde going to college with Josh. One night, Josh and Beth hook up and make a videotape the same day that Josh plans to mail a video to Tiffany of him talking about college life. The wrong tape gets sent, forcing Josh, along with a few pals, to go to Austin, where Tiffany is, and stop her from seeing the tape. Full of laughs, you'll be sure to enjoy Road Trip. (imdb)

In 2028 Detroit, when Alex Murphy (Joel Kinnaman) - a loving husband, father and good cop - is critically injured in the line of duty, the multinational conglomerate OmniCorp sees their chance for a part-man, part-robot police officer. (imdb)
film.quote: Admittedly I don't remember the original that much, and I'm sure that this tamed the original. But this isn't bad. It's a solid action movie that isn't that original. I don't really like Joel in the lead most of the time, but sometimes he was okay. The opening segment is intense and pretty awesome, and the social commentary is there, while not being overly militant. So, it was a good time but will I remember it years from now? Nope.

film.summary: The incredibly spoiled and overprivileged students of Camden College are a backdrop for an unusual love triangle between a drug dealer, a virgin and a bisexual classmate. (imdb)
A suspense-thriller about a high-priced and ruthless jury &#034;consultant&#034; (Hackman) who will stop at nothing to secure a verdict on an explosive trial. (Fox)
Set in a pro-wrestling alternate universe, Glen Matthews' &quot;SAVING FACE&quot; tells the story of the downfall of a tag team when one of its members decides that he wants to be a bad guy.
film.quote: I enjoy the concept and like pro wrestling, but I wasn't really feeling it as much as I thought I would. Still an entertaining short.

film.summary: A radio talk show host unravels a conspiracy about encounters with mysterious beings known as The Shadow People and their role in the unexplained deaths of several hundred victims in the 1980s (imdb)
film.quote: I don't love it but I do enjoy it and think people should watch it. It mixes "found" footage into it and I think that makes it strong. Maybe it's just because I like when movies try to pass off what happens as real, but I got into it for the most part. Besides, I see lots of people on the net looking into this as if it IS real, so that lends some mystique to the entire experience. It's not as creepy as I would have liked, however. Could have been more with this premise.

film.summary: A hurricane composed of sharks, attack Los Angeles.
film.quote: Well considering the movie is supposed to be schlocky, I think it was fun. They don't wink at the camera, they just seriously made a bad movie. So really, it comes down to... was it entertaining? Did it amuse? Yeah sort of. I actually think something called Sharknado could have been fucking awesome, like holy shit this is as memorable as The Room. It didn't reach heights that will make it a classic bad movie, and I know others won't appreciate it, but it was entertaining for an hour and a half.

film.summary: When he starts dating drop-dead gorgeous Molly (Alice Eve), insecure airport security agent Kirk (Jay Baruchel) can't believe it. As his friends and family share their doubts about the relationship lasting, Kirk does everything he can to avoid losing Molly forever.
film.quote: I actually found it pretty funny. I don't know what else to say really, it was more amusing than I thought it would be. Star my review.

film.summary: A young girl's "sweet sixteenth" birthday becomes anything but special as she suffers from every embarrassment possible. (imdb)
film.quote: It's okay. Most of the jokes don't actually work, but despite that, there is some charm to most of the main characters. I was entertained because of that, but this is definitely not a great movie or a classic in my eyes. It's really rough around the edges, but Hughes does display some pretty good directorial skills on occasion when he lines up some decent shots/scenes.

film.summary: In a twist to the fairy tale, the Huntsman ordered to take Snow White into the woods to be killed winds up becoming her protector and mentor in a quest to vanquish the Evil Queen. (imdb)
film.quote: Actually thought Theron kind of over-acted certain lines (but mostly did a good job), and I bought Stewart in the role until she became Xena: Warrior Princess. Sure the movie does a lot of movie things to progress the plot, cliches we've seen a million times, but great art/set design and good CGI helped create an interesting and alive fantasy world. People said this sucks shit, but despite it's few flaws, it's a good movie.

film.summary: Michael Jordan agrees to help the Looney Toons play a basketball game vs. alien slavers to determine their freedom. (imdb)
film.quote: If Bugz don't make you hop, you're buggin'.

film.summary: Peter Parker (Maguire), after being bitten by a genetically altered spider, becomes Spider-Man, a hero of superhuman strength with the ability to cling to any surface. He dedicates himself to a life of fighting crime, while living a double life as a superhero and working student. (Sony)

After returning from a wedding reception, a couple staying in an isolated vacation house receive a knock on the door in the mid-hours of the night. What ensues is a violent invasion by three strangers, their faces hidden behind masks. The couple find themselves in a violent struggle, in which they go beyond what either of them thought capable in order to survive. (imdb)
film.quote: This could have been great. The first 30 minutes or so were really intense, with some really memorable scenes, but then it just kept getting worse and worse. Still, it is a nicely directed movie from a first timer, and this is better than a lot of popular horror movies in the last few years, if only because of the beginning.

film.summary: Tom Ludlow is a veteran LAPD cop who finds life difficult to navigate after the death of his wife. When evidence implicates him in the execution of a fellow officer, he is forced to go up against the cop culture he's been a part of his entire career, ultimately leading him to question the loyalties of everyone around him. (imdb)
The coming of age summer-camp saga of four best friends who hate each other. (imdb)
After his wife falls under the influence of a drug dealer, an everyday guy transforms himself into Crimson Bolt, a superhero with the best intentions, though he lacks for heroic skills. (imdb)
film.quote: I enjoyed Kick-Ass more than this. I don't know, it sometimes worked for me and other times it didn't. The dark comedy didn't really succeed, but when it stopped and showed how disturbing the violence of a superhero could be, then it worked. Always like Ellen Page (and not just because I'm from NS ;)), but this movie went from an 80, to a 40, back to an 80, and I'm settling on 65 because it mostly is a good movie.

film.summary: Bryan Mills, an Ex-government operative is accused of a ruthless murder he never committed or witnessed as he is tracked and pursued, Bryan Mills brings out his particular set of skills to find the true killer and clear his name. (imdb)
film.quote: I know Taken 3 is inevitably going to get a lot of hate but it's really not a bad movie. Most action movies are stupid, so I don't care if the action is silly sometimes because I'm going to this movie to see someone kick ass. There are no gaping plot holes that make it unforgivable, and it does a decent enough job giving Neeson a reason to be a badass. It's better than the second. The series is getting tired, but it's still mildly enjoyable. A pretty good action flick, ultimately.

film.summary: A working girl tears through Tinseltown on Christmas Eve searching for the pimp who broke her heart. (imdb)
film.quote: Tangerine is a brave film in the way it embraces ostracized transgender people, and being filmed on iPhone 5s equipped with an anamorphic adapter lens is an interesting gimmick. However, its attempts at humor fall flat with amateurish writing and shallow jokes, and the drama just doesn't quite work. I appreciate the set-up of the film more than I actually liked the execution.

film.summary: After her mother dies from a heroin overdose, Jeliza-Rose is taken from the big city to a rural farmhouse by her father. As she tries to settle into a new life in a house her father had purchased for his now-deceased mother, Jeliza-Rose&#039;s attempts to deal with what&#039;s happened result in increasingly odd behavior, as she begins to communicate mainly with her bodiless Barbie doll heads and Dell, a neighborhood woman who always wears a beekeeper&#039;s veil. (imdb)
film.quote: Interesting imagery but that's about it. Not a fan of this one.

film.summary: Aliens make Earth their final battleground. As the forces of evil seek the key to ultimate power, Earth's last chance for survival rest in the hands of young Sam Witwicky. (Paramount Pictures)
film.quote: You want explosions and robots and you get it. You also get a decent enough love story between two humans. I actually found this movie pretty funny as well. There's even a scene or two with some emotional weight. The CGI is also well done. It's worth seeing this once.

film.summary: A man is captured by a maniac and tortured, physically and mentally, into becoming a walrus. (imdb)
film.quote: Parks and Long were awesome. 40 minutes (or so) in - Really creepy, great dialogue, some genuinely funny parts. Walrus reveal is gross and demented (great). Should be an 85 at least. Rest of movie - "Cameo" seriously hurts film, so weird-for-the-sake-of-weird . Rest of film is uneven. Tone shifts aren't done that well, comedy sometimes falls flat, becomes a little dull, horror doesn't work mostly, doesn't commit to anything. The end - oddly moving though, and definitely original. Also well shot.

film.summary: A thriller centered on a con artist, his wife, and a stranger who try to flee a foreign country after one of them is caught up in the murder of a police officer. (TMDb)
film.quote: Pretty good thriller, with solid performances. It's nothing remarkable in any way, but due to the atmosphere and especially the music, it feels like an old thriller/drama from the earlier days of cinema. It's got decent enough drama and suspense all the way through, and it's shot well.

film.summary: A chronicle of the life of Louis Zamperini, an Olympic runner who was taken prisoner by Japanese forces during World War II. (imdb)
film.quote: It just really needed to be tightened up. O'Connell is going to make a name for himself, so I don't fault him with anything here. It just kinda goes on and on. At some point you stop being like, "oh those bastards, this is disgusting" and you start going, "whatever." There were moments of real emotion, but then the momentum goes and it slows down too much. A slow movie is fine but there's gotta be something there to grip you and sometimes Unbroken forgot that. Still decent, great story.

film.summary: When human forces discover the existence of the Vampire and Lycan clans, a war to eradicate both species commences. The vampire warrioress Selene leads the battle against humankind. (imdb)
film.quote: Kate Beckinsale, vampires, werewolves, cool action scenes, pretty good visuals and atmosphere... check. But then I felt like the movie fucked me because the movie set up a sequel in the worst possible way ever... by lacking content. I mean c'mon, you were doing SO GOOD, add another half hour onto this short as hell movie and then I probably have no complaints. Entertaining but that really irked me. Still see it, though.

film.summary: Underworld: Evolution continues the saga of war between the aristocratic Death Dealers and the barbaric Lycans (werewolves). The film traces the beginnings of the ancient feud between the two tribes as the beautiful vampire heroine Selene (Beckinsale) discovers that she has been betrayed by her own kind and seeks her revenge.
