But when Coach Klein (Winkler) makes the call that allows Bobby to finally stand up for himself, it unleashes a torrent of bottled-up frustration ... and exposes a talent for tackling that transforms him from a meek &#034;water distribution engineer&#034; into the hardest hitter ever to roam the gridiron! (Buena Vista Entertainment)
A New York nightclub manager tries to save his brother and father from Russian mafia hit men. (imdb)
film.quote: Just average. But I like Mark Wahlberg in this type of role.

film.summary: While recovering from a tragic accident on the road, the patrolman Edward Malus receives a letter from his former fiancée Willow, who left him years ago without any explanation, telling that her daughter Rowan is missing. Edward travels to the private island of Summerisle, where Willow lives in an odd community that plant fruits, and she reveals that Rowan is actually their daughter... (imdb)
film.quote: New perspective: It's a great comedy. I'm not sure if Cage was the only one who thought it was a comedy or not, but I'll take his word for it that it's not an unintentional comedy. It's worth a watch cuz it's bad and funny.

film.summary: Set in Boise, ID, on the football field of Bronco Stadium. There, a flock of stewardesses and showgirls converge, forming intricate dance/movement patterns both on the field and in the sky, their actions dictated by Goodyear, a goddess hovering overhead, simultaneously occupying two Goodyear blimps. While surveying her subjects, each version of Goodyear arranges grapes in a formation on the floor, which are then carried out by the dancers below.
film.quote: Like a few people said, this is boring. 40 minutes of similar shots over and over and over again. But, the imagery is gorgeous and uses some pretty interesting things to make it's point. I especially like the blue football field. It's clear what it's about, and the music especially pushes the idea forward (makes it feel joyous). I'm torn on it. If you can seperate yourself from how dull it is, and appreciate the imagery it's probably worth a watch at least once.

film.summary: Set in modern-day Manhattan, this is an adaptation of &#034;Les Liaisons Dangereuses,&#034; the classic and scandalous Pierre Laclos novel of sexual manipulation and romantic war games first published in 1782. (Columbia TriStar)
film.quote: In your FACE Cruel Intentions, you damn movie I rented because I was a horny teenage boy!

film.summary: The residents of a rural mining town discover that an unfortunate chemical spill has caused hundreds of little spiders to mutate into the size of SUVs. And they're hungry. (Warner Bros.)
film.quote: I'm glad that it didn't take itself too seriously, just unfortunately a lot of the jokes fell flat for me, for at least half the movie. It redeemed itself a bit after but it's a too little too late. But I do really like the conspiracy theory guy, he gave the movie most of its humour. Almost a recommendation.

film.summary: In the future, the popular game is called Gene-Fusion... where people mix up DNA and create animals that then fight one another. Four kids are chosen to be 'Fusers' and they are involved in trying to save the world from aliens. (Myself)
film.quote: Props for an interesting idea. There is potential here for good commentary and excitement. It doesn't really deliver. I don't know how much it cost but the animation isn't very good. The character models are serviceable (reminds me of Timesplitters and Team Fortress 2, actually), but it doesn't look good in action a lot of the time, which takes away oomph of things like battle scenes. And everything else is by the books and some of the voice acting is lame. Not awful, but skip it.

film.summary: The U.S. military makes a scarred bounty hunter with warrants on his own head an offer he cannot refuse: in exchange for his freedom, he must stop a terrorist who is ready to unleash Hell on Earth.
film.quote: Underwhelming. I wanted to love it because it's a comic book movie and comic books haven't been represented well in movies, generally. But this isn't worth your time. It's not awful it's just kind of there and it doesn't need to be there. It lingers like the relative you don't like.

film.summary: Raw. Honest. Naked. "Kissing on the Mouth" is post-college life in close-up. Ellen is sleeping with her ex-boyfriend while trying to ignore the fact that he's looking for more than just sex. Her roommate, Patrick, isn't helping matters with his secretive and jealous behavior. The small cast served as the only crew on this intimate and humorous film featuring real interviews with recent college graduates and a documentary approach to the graphic sex and conversations. (imdb)
film.quote: Needed to go deeper, some legit characters in here, acting was decent at best, camera work kills most of the good things about it. I admire certain aspects of the actual production, and I appreciate the willingness to go the whole way and show jerking off in the shower and cumming. Ellen is cute so her naked is good but the scenes get ridiculous. Not worth a watch but almost.

film.summary: It's a nail-biting race against time as an unmanned train carrying a load of lethal chemicals speeds out of control, and a conductor and engineer do everything in their power to keep it from derailing and killing tens of thousands of people. Denzel Washington leads the cast in Tony Scott's tough-minded thriller, in which a terrible circumstance forces a couple of ordinary men to become extraordinary heroes.
film.quote: I saw people saying that this is Scott's best film and I don't know where that's coming from. I actually like him, I like how stylish he is. I like Denzel Washington too. But besides the last little bit, I wasn't really that involved with what I was watching. It was just loud and kind of tedious. Not a movie I hate but I'm not giving it a recommendation either. Close but no train. Oh wait, that didn't work... I suck at this.

film.filmname: Blue Collar Comedy Tour: The Movie (2003)
film.summary: The comedic stylings of four sort-of famous funnymen are brought to the big screen courtesy of this 2002 documentary. (imdb)
film.quote: 1 of them is really funny. Two of them are not. 1 is okay. That's all you need to know, really. (Ron White is the funny one and he's not THAT funny).

film.summary: Two rival North Carolina politicians with presidential aspirations tangle with one another. (imdb)
film.quote: I suppose you could say the movie is a critique on the absurdity of politics, but I'm not even sure the makers of it wanted it to be anything more than a Ferrell/Galifianakis comedy with a political backdrop. Meaning it makes fun of politics but doesn't tackle it in any real meaningful or militant way. My brother really liked it, I'm mostly indifferent. I don't recommend it but it does have a few good laughs. Too few and far between, however. Also not a huge Zach or Will fan for what it's worth.

film.summary: Forced underground by the next ice age, a struggling outpost of survivors must fight to preserve humanity against a threat even more savage than nature. (imdb)
film.quote: I almost gave it a pass because the atmosphere is fine, it looks chilly throughout, and I know it's all cliche but I feel a lot of movies are so as long as it's done well it's okay. It was... an alright movie. There's just little things that keep me from giving this even a minor recommendation. Stupid logic. They could have made these baddies legit intimidating but they don't, and they want us to believe they are.

film.summary: Owen Wilson stars as a married man whose spouse (Jenna Fischer) grants him the right -- for just one week -- to pursue as many extramarital affairs as he can. His best buddy (Jason Sudeikis) receives an identical "hall pass" from his wife, and off the guys go. The hubbies soon discover, however, that picking up girls isn't as easy as they recall, while their better halves embark on their own erotic adventures.
film.quote: Not quite a recommendation. The jokes don't work nearly as often as they should, it's cliche, blah blah blah, and it's only mildly entertaining, but it's not even mildly entertaining all the time. There are tits and attractive women, though.

film.summary: A black ops super soldier seeks payback after she is betrayed and set up during a mission. (imdb)
film.quote: Really disappointed. I expected good things considering the talent involved. The movie gets props for trying to do something a tad different than the normal action-thriller, but I felt like a lot of it didn't work. The chases were lame, I didn't feel the music fit the atmosphere and even the MMA type fight scenes didn't have the energy they should have. Mediocre acting and script as well. It had the makings of something amazing buried in there but failed.

film.summary: Four fighters from different backgrounds come together to train under an ex-MMA rising star and then ultimately have to fight each other and the traitor in heir midst. (imdb)
film.quote: Train MMA for 3 or 4 days and you will be awesome! They take real MMA stuff and then add typical movie martial arts to it. I don't even mind that, it's nice seeing some basis in MMA reality. Acting is bad, the movie is more serious. The first had cool music and was pretty people havin' a good time with the whole production, this didn't feel like that, and it didn't do what it did real well. And they seem to just namedrop MMA things in order to be seen as 'legit.' At least Machida is in it.

film.summary: Wes Craven presents a suspense thriller at 30,000 feet. Lisa Reisert (McAdams) hates to fly, but the terror that awaits her on the night flight to Miami has nothing to do with fear of flying. Moments after takeoff, Lisa&#039;s seatmate Jackson (Murphy), menacingly reveals that he is an operative in a plot to kill the Deputy Secretary of Homeland Security -- and Lisa is the key to his success. (DreamWorks Pictures)

While acclimating to campus life, college freshman Sara (Minka Kelly) begins to realize that her new roommate, Rebecca (Leighton Meester), is becoming obsessed with her. When the unhinged Rebecca starts targeting Sara's friends and loved ones, can she save them -- and herself?
film.quote: There are some unforgivable moments when a normal girl has superpowers, and it's almost completely by the books. At the same time, sometimes it's pretty inspired (mostly when it just sticks to making her creepy). I guess ultimately, even though I feel that they did a decent enough job making her creepy, I can't give this a recommendation based on the fact it makes you feel "meh." It doesn't thrill because it's predictable, it doesn't make you feel and it's mostly generic (few scenes excluded).

film.summary: A congressman (Matt Damon) who's a rising star on the political scene finds himself entranced by a beautiful ballerina (Emily Blunt), but mysterious circumstances ensure that their love affair is predestined to be a non-starter. Screenwriter George Nolfi (The Bourne Ultimatum) makes his directorial debut with this romantic adaptation of Philip K. Dick's classic sci-fi short story "Adjustment Team."
film.quote: It's not a recommendation from me but it's not awful. It's just really shallow... I don't know why people are saying it's deep at all. Any movie can throw out an idea and not explore it with any depth. This would be forgivable if I felt there was some great quality, like an interesting story. There isn't. It plods along, generally being decent, never being amazing. Damon and Blunt are good (they're the highlight though I wouldn't say they're dazzling the audience), but the movie just falls flat.

film.summary: An epic adventure about a global cataclysm that brings an end to the world and tells of the heroic struggle of the survivors.
film.quote: It's not really that I hated the movie, I just don't think you need to see it. Some of the disaster scenes are beautiful and, dare I say, gripping, but at some point you stop caring. I get that it's a disaster flick and it achieves that, with a little bit of emotion and John Cusack, but it's just so typical I don't see the point. It also drags at the beginning and the end... so the middle is pretty much what gives this a 45. And stop using these stupid cliches.

film.summary: A ferocious retelling of the ancient Battle of Thermopylae in which King Leonidas (Butler) and 300 Spartans fought to the death against Xerxes and his massive Persian army. Facing insurmountable odds, their valor and sacrifice inspire all of Greece to unite against their Persian enemy, drawing a line in the sand for democracy.
film.quote: Visuals were nice, too much slow motion, boring action.

film.summary: A forensic accountant un-cooks the books for illicit clients (imdb)
film.quote: It's cool to have an autistic person as the main character, and Affleck does a good enough job. Bernthal was good, as well, and the other people were just kinda there. And the movie itself was fine up until a certain point, where it seemingly shifted into another movie and they started forcing emotion in there. It just got kinda stupid so I can't recommend it, and apparently autism gives you super strength. HE ONLY KICKED HIM ONCE!

film.summary: When his long suffering girlfriend disappears suddenly, leaving a cryptic note as her only explanation, Hank's comfortable life and his sanity begin to crack. Then, from the woods surrounding his house, something terrible starts trying to break in. (imdb)
film.quote: It starts off interestingly enough; a romantic scene that is ripped from us when we are treated to the night time, when the monster comes. And I was quite enjoying this up until a certain point where it started to derail itself and feel amateurish. There's a long shot that overstays its welcome, and then a scene a while after that overstays its welcome as well. There's good stuff like the tension at night, but it still never amounts to anything amazing, which is a shame because the idea here is

film.summary: Anti Matter is a sci-fi noir take on the Alice in Wonderland tale. Ana, an Oxford PhD student, finds herself unable to build new memories following an experiment to generate and travel through a wormhole. The story follows her increasingly desperate efforts to understand what happened, and to find out who - or what - is behind the rising horror in her life (imdb)
film.quote: I'm disappointed. While at times it's pretty clever, it's a lot crammed into one movie and it doesn't satisfy on any of the accounts. The way it wraps up is the worst offender; it explains the twist and then keeps going and going and going. It tries for some emotional depth and doesn't get it. I almost gave it a passing grade because it's harmless sci-fi, but then as I wrote this I realized that I don't think I actually enjoyed it.

film.summary: Salem high school senior Lily and her pals spend their time in a haze of social media and partying. When the people of Salem are targeted in a malicious data hack, all privacy is destroyed and lives are ruined as deadly secrets are exposed. The small town turns on each other and descends into violent chaos as they hunt for the culprit. Lily and her friends must band together if they want to survive the night.
film.quote: Not enough space on Criticker to discuss the message, but even though I can appreciate militant methods (like the Purge), this is... questionable, to say the least. Anyway, as a movie it's not what it could be. The premise is silly but it could have worked, we could have had fun with this and had badass chicks but the final act falls seriously flat. The rest of it is okay, very stylish and energetic, probably helped me forgive its shortcomings to some degree, and yet I can't quite recommend it.

film.summary: In an alternative Victorian Age Gotham City, Batman begins his war on crime while he investigates a new series of murders by Jack the Ripper. (imdb)
film.quote: I don't think I would recommend this because there's just not enough here. The animation isn't good, the plot is unsatisfying, the script is wonky. Generally an animated Batman movie will get at least a pass from me, and I actually enjoyed the OG comic, but this is just not good enough to warrant a watch.

film.summary: A dramatized account of a great Russian naval mutiny and a resulting street demonstration which brought on a police massacre.
film.quote: Pretty much in agreement with Anomaly1 on this one. Before the steps, it was okay, and then the steps were great, especially seeing a kid die (because even movies today seem to be scared of showing it). Then the next part isn't even okay, it's a yawn fest. It's well made, especially for its time, and it's important, definitely, but it's pretty boring a lot of the time. And at such a short run time, that kinda sucks that it feels longer than it is.

film.summary: The story concerns a precocious boy, Henry, and his younger brother, Peter, being raised by their single mother, Susan. Henry has a crush on their neighbor Christina, the daughter of the Police Commissioner. To protect Christina from harm at the hands of her father, Henry comes up with a plan to rescue her that he writes down in a book. Henry's mother discovers the book and decides that she and Peter will put Henry's scheme into motion. (Wikipedia)
film.quote: It's not atrocious. The first half or so is a fairly decent drama with some emotional oomph, even if it's a little hokey. After that it becomes a weird murder movie that feels way too convenient because of Henry and his tape; boring and out of place. Certain elements are ignored, it gets a little silly, but there's no "maudlin twist" as RT states. I'm seeing a slightly different movie tonally then others, but I still don't think it's a good movie. Cut the second half and it may be okay.

film.summary: After a scientific experiment aboard the space station involving a particle accelerator has unexpected results, the astronauts find themselves isolated. Following their horrible discovery, the space station crew must fight for survival. (imdb)
film.quote: It was set up interestingly and after the Shepard is fired it's an intense sci-fi mind-fuck briefly but then you realize that one character on the news gave away everything, so despite a few scattered moments/elements that reach higher, it's a movie that's mostly just going through the space horror motions. This is essential for tying together the narratives of the first and second film, but does that mean I should recommend it? I don't know that I can. Could have been 15 minutes long, honestly.

film.summary: An heiress who's been shut inside her apartment building for nearly two decades is forced to confront her fears after one of her neighbors is killed and a detective arrives to begin the investigation. (imdb)
film.quote: Not bad, but not worth seeing. Some of the time they just seem to throw shit out the window for the sake of moving the plot along, and yeah it's pretty ridiculous sometimes. But it's fairly entertaining regardless.

film.summary: Buster is playing golf with Sybil when he gets knocked out. An escaped prisoner changes clothes with him. Buster goes to prison and learns that he is to be hanged. He changes clothes with a guard just as prisoner Roberts attacks all the guards. (imdb)
film.quote: I think it just takes a lot for me to really like Slapstick and find it hilarious. It is what it is. It's just not for me but for big fans of slapstick, maybe you'll like it more.

film.summary: A mild-mannered radio executive strives to become the best stepdad to his wife's two children, but complications ensue when their freewheeling and freeloading real father arrives, forcing him to compete for the affection of the kids. (imdb)
film.quote: Gotta be honest: not horrible. I don't recommend it unless you're desperate for a comedy, but there are some actual laughs here and a slightly touching story. It still fails more than it hits, but there's a certain cameo that was really awesome. Wahlberg is just great in comedies even if the material isn't always solid... still charming as hell.

film.summary: Fate deals young orphan Matt Murdock a strange hand when he is doused with hazardous waste. The accident leaves Matt blind but also gives him a heightened "radar sense" that allows him to "see" far better than any man. Years later Murdock has grown into a man and becomes a respected criminal attorney. But after he's done his "day job" Matt takes on a secret identity as "The Man Without Fear," Daredevil, the masked avenger that patrols the neighborhood of Hell's Kitchen and New York City to combat the injustice that he cannot tackle in the courtroom. (imdb)
film.quote: The 45 mainly comes about because of a few really good, powerful scenes. Ben Afleck isn't to blame here, though, the script and the effects are.

film.summary: A young man encounters a mysterious woman in his house.
film.quote: I don't think I see the appeal. I guess it was supposed to be funny? I didn't find it funny at all. The drama was alright though, the "I think so" was well played by Cera, and that's the reason I give it a 45 instead of like a 30. It's not a terrible short, but I just don't see it as much at all. I didn't really even feel the awkwardness that I was supposed to.

film.summary: Jerry's inept crime falls apart due to his and his henchmen's bungling and the persistent police work of pregnant Marge Gunderson.
film.quote: I know this is a great movie and I should love it but I don't. I really don't have a good reason why.

film.summary: La Fée aux Choux is sixty seconds long, possibly making it the earliest known film with a running time of at least one minute. (Wikipedia)
A pointless animated short.
film.quote: Did you just kick that fucking dog? What the hell man? Ah, this short is okay. The animation isn't anything great, but when he kicks the dog and the music starts, shit gets real. I'm not going to recommend it because it really is "a pointless animated short," so I don't know why I even bothered watching it. I saw some animal cruelty though.

film.summary: Brent Magna must get behind the wheel and follow the orders of a mysterious man to save his kidnapped wife. (imdb)
film.quote: Criticker says I'd give this a 0 but damn it's not that bad. In fact, it's not really bad, it's just not recommended. There are better movies to watch. It kind of reminds me of Saw but in a car... meaning when the twist comes around it's kind of like Jigsaws intentions in Saw, if you think about it. Selena Gomez is lovely, Ethan Hawke was fine, and there were some decent moments here and there, but it really just didn't feel like it had a lot of life most of the time and felt a lil silly.

film.summary: Maximus is a powerful Roman general, loved by the people and the aging Emperor, Marcus Aurelius. Before his death, the Emperor chooses Maximus to be his heir over his own son, Commodus, and a power struggle leaves Maximus and his family condemned to death. The powerful general is unable to save his family, and his loss of will allows him to get captured and put into the Gladiator games until he dies.
A group of 30-year-olds who have been friends since high school attempt to throw an end-of-summer orgy.
film.quote: Not the worst movie by any means, and the fact there's tits helps the (straight) guys out. But really this isn't funny in the least. There's like one or two moments where I sort of chuckled. I have been watching a bunch of these raunchy comedies over the past couple years and they just aren't amusing me that often. It's like, HEY LET'S SAY WHAT TEA-BAGGING IS AND IT'LL BE FUNNY! It's not. It might help if I actually got shocked into laughing but I just don't.

film.summary: Rodin's sculpture The Thinker is a sentient being. (imdb)
film.quote: I adore the movies I've seen from Carax (Mauvais Sang and Holy Motors), and I have every intention of visiting more of his filmography, but what? I mean, it starts out with a naked girl which is probably 40 points of this, but this is really just a very miniscule, uninteresting short. Carax can be pretty odd but this isn't appealing odd... listening to the short conversation between The Thinker and the girl isn't that amusing but I think it wanted to be (or philosophical).

film.summary: A Hollywood fixer in the 1950s works to keep the studio's stars in line. (imdb)
film.quote: The Coens have this issue where they have a great setup with quirky characters and an intelligent script, and yet they leave me feeling really cold sometimes. This is one of those cases: HC is not terrible, but it failed as a comedy and while I think the premise is fine, the direction is solid and the love of the '50s shines, I just couldn't care about what was going on. The offbeat tone suffocates it and becomes awkward, and it's like they can't strike the balance.

film.summary: Right after the bachelor party in Las Vegas, Phil, Stu, Alan, and Doug jet to Thailand for Stu's wedding. Stu's plan for a subdued pre-wedding brunch, however, goes seriously awry. (imdb)
film.quote: I think I rated the first one like an 80 or something because I could see the appeal. With that said, I didn't lose my shit over the first one like a lot of people seemed to. There were a few really funny parts, like "Nigga please, we're both dead inside," but the first movie wasn't good enough for the second to rely on the same shit. Tyson is always nice to see, but it wasn't great. Stu's song wasn't great. They 'upped' all the stuff the boys go through, but it wasn't half as funny.

film.summary: A paranoid thriller about a family on the run from a natural crisis that presents a large-scale threat to humanity. (imdb)

This short film by Yuri Norstein tells the story of two would-be lovers, Heron and Crane, whose pride and self-importance continually prevent them from accepting each other's proposals of marriage, despite their desire for each other. (keyframeonline.com)
film.quote: I enjoy the animation quite a bit, but I couldn't get into the story at all. Even when a short running time I felt it was repetitive and uninteresting.

film.summary: HOLIDAYS is an anthology feature film that puts a uniquely dark and original spin on some of the most iconic and beloved holidays of all time by challenging our folklore, traditions and assumptions. (imdb)
film.quote: I don't think I'd give this a pass because it's so inconsistent, even though I like the idea of anthology films. Valentine's Day was kinda funny, St. Patrick's was kinda boring, Easter was entertaining, Mother's Day was bland, Father's Day was excellent with some real tension until it fell apart at the end, Halloween was unsatisfying and below Smith, Christmas was forgettable and New Year's Eve was the best of the bunch with a fun twist and character. As a collection it doesn't really add up.

film.summary: New York City is full of lonely hearts seeking the right match, and what Alice, Robin, Lucy, Meg, Tom and David all have in common is the need to learn how to be single in a world filled with ever-evolving definitions of love. (imdb)
film.quote: You might be asking, why is a single 30 year old watching this? Alison Brie, that's why. But in all seriousness, not enough of her. But Johnson does a good job. It's not really a good movie, as it falls into familiar trappings of the genre and doesn't bring much to the table besides a fun cast. There were a couple funny moments but not enough, and the message was muddled and unfocused. But still not a dreadful flick.

film.summary: Steve Coogan and Paul Rudd star as Erasmus and Paul, a bickering gay couple whose life is turned inside out when a ten-year old boy shows up at their door claiming to be Erasmus' grandson. Neither Paul, nor Erasmus, are ready to give up their extravagant lifestyles to be parents, but maybe this little kid has thing or two to teach them about the value of family. (imdb)
film.quote: Keeping up with my own tradition: I love seeing Rudd regardless. With that out of the way, I didn't much care for this. I found it a little boring and unfunny for most of it, though there were a couple good jokes. By the time it kicked it up a notch and got good it was near the end of the movie so it can't really quite save itself. Also, the ending was incredibly rushed. It's not the worst thing to watch if you're bored but I still wouldn't recommend it because it just felt so inconsequential.

film.summary: Two decades after the first Independence Day invasion, Earth is faced with a new extra-Solar threat. But will mankind's new space defenses be enough? (imdb)
film.quote: Generally an okay action movie gets a passing grade from me because I'm easier on the genre and find a lot of them to be an entertaining way to pass the time, even if they're insubstantial. This follows all of the formulaic elements that the genre is known for, but I didn't ever feel like the world was at risk. I know, there was no way that Earth didn't win, and there's a lot of disaster but it didn't feel it ultimately. That makes it hard to forgive the wonkiness in other areas.

film.summary: A team of scientists aboard the International Space Station discover a rapidly evolving life form, that caused extinction on Mars, and now threatens the crew and all life on Earth.
film.quote: Not terrible but I wouldn't recommend it. It adds nothing to the formula, which would be fine but I found that it just plodded along. At one point I realized I just wanted it to end. Inspired by Alien but there's literally a better Alien this year. I expected a neat ending because of what people were saying, but this was a typical horror movie ending. I will say that I love the music that plays during the end; if only the rest of the movie captured that much dread.

film.summary: When Jimmy Logan loses his job working on underground repairs at the Charlotte Motor Speedway, and learns that his ex-wife Bobbie Jo and her new husband are planning to move interstate with Jimmy's daughter Sadie, he devises a plan that requires the involvement of his bartender brother Clyde.
film.quote: This is just like The Informant for me. It left me incredibly cold. Driver and Tatum have chemistry and at the beginning they are the best part. Unfortunately, they are kinda separated and their interactions aren't prominent, so we're left with a clever flick that feels really insubstantial with no consequences or drama. I like cool heist flicks but Soderbergh himself has done this genre better before. Still, good cast, they do what they can, it's just mostly boring.

film.summary: THE LONGEST RIDE centers on the star-crossed love affair between Luke, a former champion bull rider looking to make a comeback, and Sophia, a college student who is about to embark upon her dream job in New York City's art world. As conflicting paths and ideals test their relationship, Sophia and Luke make an unexpected and fateful connection with Ira, whose memories of his own decades-long romance with his beloved wife deeply inspire the young couple. (imdb)
film.quote: It's too long and wouldn't have had any emotional punch had Ira not been in it (let's be honest, his love story is more compelling because he's old). Despite it being manipulative, I can't deny that there weren't moments that got me... even though I knew it was trying to play me hard. The ending was stupid, but this isn't the worst romantic movie I've ever seen. 45 places it in a "close but no cigar" type of category.

film.filmname: The Lord of the Rings: The Two Towers (2002)
film.summary: In the second chapter in J.R.R Tolkien's epic trilogy, the Fellowship faces unimaginable armies and deception while also witnessing ancient wonders and the untapped strength of their people. (New Line Productions)
film.quote: More action makes this a more enthralling experience than the Fellowship of the Rings while still maintaining the Tolkien (almost) level of detail to the sets/surroundings. I still don't like it.

film.summary: Debra Winger and Tracy Letts play a long-married, dispassionate couple who are both in the midst of serious affairs. But on the brink of calling it quits, a spark between them suddenly reignites, leading them into an impulsive romance.
film.quote: From the opening this had a hard time keeping me involved. Some will say that The Lovers has a sweeping, romantic score that punctuates all the drama, but to me it came across as cheesy. The acting and dialogue is completely wonky, so any interesting ways that it could delve into these relationships is held back by good actors phoning it in. For a while I thought this was meant to be a parody of romance movies but it's not.

film.summary: A lonely woman befriends a group of teenagers and decides to let them party at her house. Just when the kids think their luck couldn't get any better, things start happening that make them question the intention of their host. (imdb)
film.quote: I wouldn't say it's terrible but I also wouldn't recommend it. Like others have said, Spencer is the highlight here as she crazies all over the place. The rest of it is whatever. Even for a movie people make really stupid choices; I can only forgive that kind of convenience to a certain point and this passes that.

film.filmname: The Man Who Killed Hitler and Then the Bigfoot (2019)
film.summary: A legendary American war veteran is recruited to hunt a mythical creature. (imdb)
film.quote: This is not the fun, ridiculous romp that you'd expect from such an outrageous premise/title. Instead, it is mostly an old man reflecting on his life, specifically about the love of his life. But there's also the killing of Hitler and Bigfoot, neither of which is very compelling, with the latter just being silly... flying in the face of what the rest of the movie is offering. I can't say that I enjoyed this, I can say I admire it to some degree.

film.summary: A tour into the heart of a Hollywood family chasing celebrity, one another and the relentless ghosts of their pasts.
film.quote: The worst Cronenberg movie I've seen, but it's still almost passable. Julianne Moore was wonderful yet again, and it offers an off-kilter look at the Hollywood lifestyle. I reckon the satire is on point, even if it's nothing original, but it left me feeling cold. Cosmopolis did that too but I was more into it and enjoyed it quite a bit, but the detached dialogue, the sometimes stiff acting and general weirdness didn't do it for me this time around. Competently made but wooden and unappealing.

film.summary: The most dangerous hitman in the world, Arthur Bishop thought he had put his murderous past behind him when his most formidable foe kidnaps the love of his life. Now he is forced to travel the globe to complete three impossible assassinations, and do what he does best, make them look like accidents. (imdb)
film.quote: These movies aren't BAD, but they're not worth seeing either. There are some good action sequences, and I enjoy Statham in action roles, even if the movies themselves aren't always good. That's about it really: this might appeal to those who just want a silly action film, but this one wasn't good enough to recommend.

film.summary: A pair of teenage girls in rural Pennsylvania travel to New York City to seek out medical help after an unintended pregnancy. (imdb)
film.quote: I don't absolutely hate it and I think that there are some good parts--namely when she's talking to the counselor the part that the movie is named after--but I have more issues. It was a little tedious and lacked oomph a lot of the time; the girls never built a good enough relationship to be engaging. Lost interest many times but still appreciate how unwavering it is in what it wants to explore. Problematic feminist issues are present; not offended, it was just awfully simplistic.

film.summary: A priest with a haunted past and a novitiate on the threshold of her final vows are sent by the Vatican to investigate the death of a young nun in Romania and confront a malevolent force in the form of a demonic nun. (imdb)
film.quote: It's bland and doesn't earn its jump scares, while also not being the worst horror movie I've ever seen. They overused the actual nun and it lost its impact. I think they should have kept her imagery locked away for a little and then when you finally fully see her it would have been more terrifying, because the character works in very small doses. Every other element is okay but whatever, I wouldn't recommend seeing it unless you're a Conjuringverse fanatic, which I'm not.

film.summary: A couple has checked into a nondescript hotel, video camera in hand, to make their very first sex tape. He starts shooting; the camera is date stamped January 3, 2003, at 3:23 in the afternoon. He&#039;s excited, he gets the lens cap off, but soon he seems to be getting more than he bargained for. She turns out to be pretty accomplished at this, an argument ensues, and the camera may be recording something completely different from what was planned. (imdb)
film.quote: Not a fan. But I don't completely hate it either. It just leans slightly into "non-recommendation" territory. I actually believed the people but just, blah. It isn't enough, somehow.

film.summary: When a young boy accidentally triggers the universe's most lethal hunters' return to Earth, only a ragtag crew of ex-soldiers and a disgruntled science teacher can prevent the end of the human race.
film.quote: Having only seen the first Predator this is extremely at odds with what I want. There are some good laughs, a few good deaths but then what else? It's incredibly generic and lifeless, the mixture of horror/comedy/action didn't work because nothing felt menacing. Predator managed drama along with some badass moments and good direction, this felt so painfully average. It was a waste of the Predator itself. Slipped into tedium a little too often to even give a minor recommendation.

film.summary: A retired assassin is drawn back into the life he gave up when his daughter is kidnapped. To rescue her, he must confront his former rival. (imdb)
film.quote: It's not terrible, just a little dull and uninspired. The shoot outs really aren't that exciting at all, and many will say it's a lesser 'Taken' (it is), but it's not without its good parts. Cusack/Willis r underused but r seemingly just phoning it in anyway. It's a nice touch that the main character actually goes and buys bullets.. it shows some attention to detail that quite a few movies lack. But there's no oomph to anything. The final shootout isn't thrilling and the last showdown is stupid.

film.summary: In Justine's family everyone is a vet and a vegetarian. At 16, she's a gifted teen ready to take on her first year in vet school, where her older sister also studies. There, she gets no time to settle: hazing starts right away. Justine is forced to eat raw meat for the first time in her life. Unexpected consequences emerge as her true self begins to emerge. (Cannes2016)
film.quote: Not as gross as you'll think it's going to be going in, which is actually okay with me because I'm not a gore hound. I almost gave this a passing grade but I can't because while I think Marillier is fine in her role, the film feels dishonest; there were times where they just put Justine in contrived situations to further her cannibalistic tendencies. Some of them were cheesy, and the coming-of-age aspects were sub-par. There were good parts scattered throughout, but I felt cold. Fake depth.

film.summary: This spooky reimagining of the classic dark-woods folk tale stars Amanda Seyfried as Valerie, a village girl who's confronting a tumultuous romantic situation when a legendary werewolf slaughters her sister. Valerie enlists the help of a veteran demon hunter (Gary Oldman) to destroy the creature, but as each cycle of the moon brings fresh deaths, Valerie begins to realize that the murderous beast may be closer to her than she'd ever dreamed.
film.quote: I thought it was better than expected, up until a certain point, and then it just became stupid and shitty. Honestly, quite a bit of it is pretty decent, with good art design, and decent performances. Sometimes the script is wonky, but that's forgivable in the beginning. But then maybe the last half hour or a little bit more, the movie tanks really badly and I just can't bring myself to recommend it. It ends up not satisfying you.

film.summary: When a weapons multi-national Palisade Defense reward their European sales division with a team-building weekend in the mountains of Eastern Europe, comedy blends with horror as the team fight first amongst themselves, and later for survival against a group of war-crazed killers intent on revenge. (imdb)
film.quote: A comedy horror that isn't really that scary but is dark and comedic. It focuses a lot on arms manufacturers and is set up like a slasher flick. So you get really absurd shit going on because that's what you expect from the genre. It does twist a few cliches on their head like naked (or at least half naked) chicks not dying. I liked it but I won't recommend it. But it comes close.

film.summary: A high school jock makes a bet that he can turn an unattractive girl into the school&#039;s prom queen. (imdb)
When a worldly singer witnesses a mob crime, the police hide her as a nun in a traditional convent where she has trouble fitting in. (imdb)
When missile technology is used to enhance toy action figures, the toys soon begin to take their battle programming too seriously. (imdb)
An orphaned teenager forms an unlikely friendship with a detective. Together they investigate her mother's murder, and uncover the supernatural force that proves to be a threat to her family.
film.quote: The premise is pretty neat. With that said it's a disappointment because it deserves a better movie than it is. Most things are okay, I suppose, but there's some wonky dialogue and acting here and there. It takes a while to get going which means you're watching a character study only the characters aren't especially interesting. It's also very very dark: just put some light on! The washed out palette does it no favours and doesn't create a compelling atmosphere.

film.summary: Col. Guile and various other martial arts heroes fight against the tyranny of Dictator M. Bison and his cohorts. (imdb)

Ray Liotta (Goodfellas) delivers an intense, electrifying performance in this explosive follow-up to the gritty urban crime thriller Street Kings. Liotta plays Detroit detective Marty Kingston, the leader of an undercover narcotics team, whose members are being systematically murdered one by one. To solve the brutal killings, Kingston joins forces with a cocky, young homicide detective. But neither of them is prepared for the shocking corruption their investigation will uncover -- stunning secret (dvdactive.com)
film.quote: It's just really uninspired. I actually liked the first one (not a lot but still). This is just not as good, but Ray Liotta gives another fine -- even though he's on autopilot... he's just a master of this kind of role -- performance. I won't recommend it because it's generic, the twists are obvious, and it doesn't do anything real well, but it's also not complete dogshit, so if you do go against what I say and rent it... I'm man enough to admit you might just enjoy it, all things considered.

film.summary: Career criminal Youngblood Priest wants out of the Atlanta drug scene, but as he ramps up sales, one little slip up threatens to bring the whole operation down before he can make his exit.
film.quote: I wrestled with myself about whether I'd give this a minor pass or fail. I'm going with fail because it's forgettable to the point that it's not worth seeing. That doesn't mean it's bad because it isn't, it's a fairly okay decent average crime movie that doesn't bring anything new or refreshing to the table while also not doing anything that well either.

film.filmname: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Out of the Shadows (2016)
film.summary: As Shredder joins forces with mad scientist Baxter Stockman and henchmen Bebop and Rocksteady to take over the world, the Turtles must confront an even greater nemesis: the notorious Krang. (imdb)
film.quote: I enjoy the first, this is a mess. I still have an intrinsic adoration for the mutants so merely seeing them on screen makes me a little happy, but there's too much crammed in here and it's not satisfying enough. The action is still pretty fun but this is a lot more hammy; everybody is corning it up and it becomes too much. I enjoy when the Turtles crack lame jokes but nobody else works... it's just not as funny as the first one. Wasted potential because so many iconic characters are present.

film.summary: A small business owner is about to lose her shop to a major corporate development. (imdb)
film.quote: It tries to parody rom-coms but it just doesn't do a good job, ultimately. It sucks because I love seeing Rudd because he's charming as shit. I hate seeing him be in crap. It's almost a little too winky-winky to be that funny, and honestly, a lot of the more over-the-top shit doesn't work, like the dreadful part about wanting to fuck his grandma. It keeps piling up joke after joke that mostly don't work (though I chuckled a couple times) and doesn't really build a compelling narrative. Shallow.

film.summary: Spinal Tap, the world's loudest band, is chronicled by hack documentarian Marti DeBergi on what proves to be a fateful tour (imdb)
film.quote: Meh. A few lines did it for me and got a smile, but I never outright laughed. I don't know if it's my general disinterest in this era of rock/metal that made me uninterested in this as well, but I just didn't find it that humorous. There are certainly some fine moments so I wouldn't say it's terrible, but this is one widely praised film that I'm just not into.

film.summary: Justin throws himself and everyone around him into chaos when he attempts to break free from his addiction to his thumb.
film.quote: The film is well crafted, especially the acting performances but that's all it really was to me. This would get an even lower score if it wasn't for those things but I can appreciate a competently made movie, but I couldn't get involved in this. Really, the only flaw is a bit one... it wanders around the point it's trying to make and never engaged me so I found myself getting bored and struggling through it. Others have clearly found more, but that's my word, yo.

film.summary: When the Russian mob kidnaps the daughter of a reformed criminal, he rounds up his old crew and seeks his own brand of justice. (imdb)
film.quote: Maybe this is blasphemy but I actually didn't mind the movie until the last 15 minutes, where it ended up falling really flat. Yes, it is wonky, Cage acts in weird ways (RAAAAAAAT), and the script is terrible. But I'm kind of a sucker for Cage, and I'm a sucker for movies where criminals reunite to kick ass. I can even stand how tripe and cliche it is because I just enjoy this kind of movie, but some scenes were so bad that it hurt the decent parts. This script needed a lot of work.

film.summary: Renton, deeply immersed in the Edinburgh drug scene, tries to clean up and get out, despite the allure of the drugs and influence of friends.

film.filmname: Valerian and the City of a Thousand Planets (2017)
film.summary: A dark force threatens Alpha, a vast metropolis and home to species from a thousand planets. Special operatives Valerian and Laureline must race to identify the marauding menace and safeguard not just Alpha, but the future of the universe. (imdb)
film.quote: Let's give the good: there are some really cool sci-fi ideas here, there are some neat designs for the world and the characters. Besson TRIES, unlike a movie like Transformers. Unfortunately, the ideas are squandered, as is the world that's built. A particular cool trailer moment is actually boring in the movie. The leads a) suck and b) have no chemistry; huge miscasting. It's too long for what it is, scenes drag and are too hamfisted. Biggest problem is that it's just not fun.

film.summary: Six years have elapsed since Guantanemo Bay, leaving Harold and Kumar estranged from one another with very different families, friends and lives. But when Kumar arrives on Harold's doorstep during the holiday season with a mysterious package in hand, he inadvertently burns down Harold's father-in-law's beloved Christmas tree. To fix the problem, Harold and Kumar embark on a mission through New York City to find the perfect Christmas tree, once again stumbling into trouble at every single turn. (imdb)
film.quote: I think this is the first in the series that I don't recommend. I really really like the first one, because it was clever and hilarious... this... not so much. Outside of a couple laughs, this really has nothing going for it. It tries way too hard and it fails 90% of the time. If it wasn't for the fact I like the characters and the claymation it'd be lot lower.

film.summary: A detective interrogates a monkey who is suspected of murder. (Netflix)
film.quote: People seem to dig this and I'm a fan of Lynch as well, but this didn't do it for me. The weirdness of the mouth on the monkey didn't work for me at all and took me out a bit. The surrealist dialogue was not as funny or as interesting as I expected it to be. I enjoyed the noir/old film aesthetic, even if not much was done with it. Like the premise, enjoyed the end, but the rest of it--including the song--just left me cold.

film.summary: U.S. Marshal Carrie Stetko tracks a killer in Antarctica, as the sun is about to set for six months.
film.quote: It's not the abortion that apparently RT (according to what another user says) thinks it is, really. There's very little great about this besides a hot view of Beckinsale, and some decent views of Antarctica. But it's not awful. It was entertaining enough despite how inconsistent it was and how little you could invest yourself in these people.

film.summary: Two teenage yoga enthusiasts team up with a legendary man-hunter to battle with an ancient evil presence that is threatening their major party plans. (imdb)
film.quote: I actually enjoy Harley and Lily-Rose together; the chemistry is obvious, and they do have some funny moments. In fact, I'd say without them this is significantly worse. Guy isn't as intolerable this time around because he doesn't come along and RUIN a decent horror flick. But this ultimately just isn't that humorous and comes across as try-hard. I almost want to give it a pass, but it can't quite get there. Also, we get it: Canada. Pucky Charms isn't funny.

film.filmname: I Know What You Did Last Summer (1997)
film.summary: After an accident on a winding road, four teens make the fatal mistake of dumping their victim&#039;s body into the sea. But exactly one year later, the dead man returns from his watery grave, and he&#039;s looking for more than an apology. (Sony)
film.quote: This is a pretty by the numbers Scream-wannabe. Not much else to say really. It's not offensively bad but it's not good.

film.summary: Meet Samuel, Jeffrey and Michael Douglas! Their grandfather, Mori Tanaka, is highly skilled in the fields of Martial Arts and Ninjitsu... (imdb)
film.quote: Liked it as a kid. I was also a stupid kid.

film.summary: Experimental film in which the camera acts as a subjective observer. (BFI)
film.quote: Trees! I can appreciate what it's trying to do. I am bias towards experimental films most of the time. There are even some nice images of trees... but this doesn't stop me from being really, really bored by it all.

film.summary: Tom Welles (Cage) is a family man with a modest home-based private investigation business living a simple life in Pennsylvania -- until a reel of crudely shot eight millimeter film sends him down a gritty and frightening path into society&#039;s darkest corners. (Sony)

When his fiancee is kidnapped by human traffickers, Roman and his ex-military brothers set out to track her down and save her before it is too late. Along the way, Roman teams up with Avery, a cop investigating human trafficking and fighting the corrupted bureaucracy that has harmful intentions. (imdb)
film.quote: It wasn't terrible but not really worth a watch, the type of movie I'll only watch at this time of the year where this is nothing else that I can watch at home. Willis looks bored when he is on screen, which isn't often, and this hits all the beats that you would expect. Admittedly, at the beginning the dialogue and situations are hokey but they do become bearable.

film.summary: George, a lonely and fatalistic teen who's made it all the way to his senior year without ever having done a real day of work, is befriended by Sally, a popular but complicated girl who recognizes in him a kindred spirit. (imdb)
film.quote: Isn't really a lot to write home about but I wouldn't go and say it's awful. I think what jhmclellan says is true, "movie is forgettable." It doesn't really do anything. It tries to tell a heart-warming story of love and I suppose it does, but the idea is kind of silly. The main character is kinda wonky. No real scenes stick out, and you know what's going to happen. We've seen it a million times, and we've seen it done better. But still not awful, just not worth seeing.

film.summary: A dystopian love story in a Texas wasteland and set in a community of cannibals. (imdb)
film.quote: It's not without merit: it's beautifully shot and embraces atmosphere in an admirable way. But it's boring and empty without a character to care about. These problems are compounded by the fact that it doesn't earn having a 2 hour runtime.

film.summary: Devoted lifeguard Mitch Buchannon butts heads with a brash new recruit. Together, they uncover a local criminal plot that threatens the future of the Bay. (imdb)
film.quote: It's better than I expected but I still didn't like it. It started off promising, though. I thought this might be a surprise comedy for me judging by the first 20 minutes or so, but then it starts to fail both as a comedy and when it's trying to be a drama/action movie. The jokes (some of which are reused) end up overstaying their welcome or just aren't funny, and I didn't care enough about anything going on. Efron sucks but the Rock is still charming as always.

film.summary: After arrogant teenager Kyle Kingson (Alex Pettyfer) humiliates a Goth classmate (Mary-Kate Olsen), she puts a curse on him that transforms him from a hunk into a hideous creature. To break the hex, Kyle must find someone who loves him for what he's become. Living with a housekeeper after his heartless father (Peter Krause) throws him out, he connects with an addict's daughter (Vanessa Hudgens) in this contemporary take on Beauty and the Beast.
film.quote: I wouldn't call it offensively bad or anything, but it's very rushed. I know a bunch of time goes by in the movie, but it feels unnatural. And it's cheesy, not in a good way. -whispers- I love you. Yeah, we get it, the words are powerful. And the way dude handled himself in a fight was like he got super powers all of a sudden. What a hero. But seriously, it's like at the beginning they make the worst possible guy ever just to show you just how quick a man can transform.

film.summary: A champion high school cheerleading squad discovers its previous captain stole all their best routines from an inner-city school and must scramble to compete at this year's championships. (imdb)
Based on skin-curdling tales of the real life "flesh eating virus," Cabin Fever blends the elements of classic horror films of the 70's and 80's with modern day medical terror. (Lions Gate Films)
film.quote: Almost, but not quite.

film.summary: A prison parolee (Cage) on his way to freedom faces impossible odds when the maximum security transport plane he's on is skyjacked by the most vicious criminals in the country. (Buena Vista Entertainment)

Bruce Willis pairs with Tracy Morgan in this Kevin Smith-directed buddy flick about two cops trying to track down a stolen mint-condition (read valuable) baseball card from the 1950s. Along the way, the guys tangle with the mob, a Mexican beauty and countless other characters in this comedic action flick co-starring Adam Brody, Jason Lee, Michelle Trachtenberg and Seann William Scott.

Based on Dan Brown&#039;s popular and controversial novel, The Da Vinci Code begins with a spectacular murder in the Louvre Museum. All clues point to a covert religious organization that will stop at nothing to protect a secret that threatens to overturn 2,000 years of accepted dogma. (Sony)
film.quote: It's boring. There are other issues with it but that's definitely the main one.

film.summary: The peaceful town of Centerville finds itself battling a zombie horde as the dead start rising from their graves.
film.quote: Great cast wasted, and that's the biggest problem. I'm all for satire, and it didn't really bother me here, but it's pretty lazy satire to be honest. I didn't find much joy here, except for a few jokes scattered throughout. Not scary enough (or at all) to be a horror, not funny enough to be considered a comedy. It flubs both. And again, that's a shame because look at that cast!

film.summary: A cop is brought out of suspended animation in prison to pursue an old ultra-violent enemy who is loose in a nonviolent future society.
A special message for roommates everywhere.
film.quote: I learned a lot from this. But seriously, you look at the title and you know what the joke is, and it's not overly funny to be honest. It's a satirical look at... oh whatever, I can't do this. Don't touch my shit.

film.summary: High-strung father-to-be Peter Highman is forced to hitch a ride with aspiring actor Ethan Tremblay on a road trip in order to make it to his child's birth on time.
film.quote: The part with Rza was cool because like someone said, "Rza makes things cool." The rest of the movie was kind of bland, with a few scattered laughs here and there.

film.summary: A comedy about a video store clerk Ed (Matthew McConaughey) whose life is thrown into chaos when he agrees to let an executive of a televison studio (Ellen DeGeneres) film him for 24 hours. (imdb)
A rabid film fan stalks his favorite action hero and destroys the star's life.
film.quote: If Moose is indeed meant to be autistic it actually does explain some of his actions (not all, but I do see some of the symptoms). That creates some sympathy from me. That it takes autism in an "offensive" direction doesn't especially bother me because it's just a movie and I don't need Fred Durst to explain autism to me. I know I'm talking a lot about autism here but that's it's the most interesting aspect. Movie just doesn't flow, has some illogical and weird choices, it's boring.

film.summary: When comedian George Simmons learns of his terminal health condition, his desire to form a genuine friendship cause him to take a green performer under his wing as his opening act.
film.quote: Kinda boring, really. Unlike another review, I thought the Eminem part was the funniest. There were a couple other jokes scattered along the way but it's really not a funny movie and the main story has some heart but isn't as good as other Apatow stories. He's been declining in quality, plus I don't like Adam Sandler generally, as a rule, it turns out.

film.filmname: Il Giorno della prima di Close Up (1996)
film.summary: The owner of a small cinema in Italy is going through the figures for the most recent blockbusters in his town and is irritated to see that the advertising space for the new Iranian film showing at his cinema (Close-Up) is significantly smaller than that of American films. He tries to promote the smaller works at every chance he gets but will it ever be able to compete with the Lion King? (imdb)
film.quote: I can get behind the message: I've ranted that amazing flicks make no money. But, why would you pick The Lion King? First of all, it's an incredible movie. Second, it's a kids movie that adults can enjoy so of course it'll stomp over everything. It's like, this flick has its heart in the right place but goes about it the wrong way. Not really an easy thing to explore in a few minutes, and the movie is too shallow and misguided in how it does it anyway. Classy ending though, nice touch.

film.summary: Laurie Strode struggles to come to terms with her brother Michael's deadly return to Haddonfield, Illinois; meanwhile, Michael prepares for another reunion with his sister
film.quote: Meh. It's not completely terrible. It throws you a bone once in a while, but it really doesn't do anything special and relies way too heavily on old cliches. I'm aware that the slasher genre is ripe with cliches anyway and it's hard to avoid but you can still be clever. There were no real memorable scenes, which sucks because Myers is such a great villain. The symbolism seemed really tacked on a lot of the time and the ending sucked. But it had a lot of attractive girls. And Weird Al.

film.summary: Gene Handsome is an LA homicide detective who tries to make sense of his life as he solves crime. Handsome's knack for solving mysteries is matched only by his inability to make sense of his own problems. (imdb)
film.quote: There's a certain charm to what Garlin is doing here. He's fine, and the actors are fine as a whole, but it tries way too hard to be funny and almost none of the jokes hit. It has an excellent reoccurring theme that plays a bunch of times throughout, but it's just such a slog. Also, I know they are trying to be quirky but you can't even appreciate the actual mystery of it because they tell you who murdered the girl at the beginning. In a more entertaining movie that would have been okay.

film.summary: When the puppet cast of an '80s children's TV show begins to get murdered one by one, a disgraced LAPD detective-turned-private eye puppet takes on the case.
film.quote: Honestly it just didn't have enough laughs for me to give it a pass, and I didn't find the movie especially exciting. With that said, there were a few good laughs, but like some others have said, it just feels like they expected this to be funny because it's puppets. I will allow some of that because to a certain extent puppets saying gross things IS funny, this had a little too much of it.

film.summary: On the way to California, a family has the misfortune to have their car break down in an area closed to the public, and inhabited by violent savages ready to attack. (imdb)
An assassin teams up with a woman to help her find her father and uncover the mysteries of her ancestry. (imdb)
film.quote: Fuck the film makers for that complete shit "hey we're making a sequel" ending. You introduce one of the cooler moments in the movie and then cut away and expect us to pay for a sequel. It's disgusting. Besides that, the plot is pretty banal but it has a few fun moments and action scenes. Also has some really dumb ones. Another poor example of how to adapt a video game adaptation but I think this is a weird series to do that to anyway cuz of the freedom of the game, which movies can't achieve.

film.summary: When ex-soldier turned mercenary, John Gold, learns of the murder of his best friend, he sets off on a mission to find out what happened. What he discovers is a sinister conspiracy and he sets about taking down those responsible one by one.
film.quote: Incredibly forgettable to the point of not being worth a watch even though King Barrett is an intimidating and believable force. I wish he would have wore the mask throughout the movie.

film.summary: A woman struggling with insecurity wakes from a fall believing she is the most beautiful and capable woman on the planet. Her new confidence empowers her to live fearlessly, but what happens when she realizes her appearance never changed? (imdb)
film.quote: Mostly a little boring. I guess Schumer does a good job despite the material, but she's losing me. I loved her in Trainwreck but then she made the awful Snatched and now this. Any message of self-confidence (which is iffy because this is a pretty hypocritical movie at times) is lost in that. I laughed once or twice, and Michelle Williams was apparently there and awesome (I didn't even recognize her)… but that's about all the positivity I can muster for this.

film.filmname: Jay and Silent Bob Get Irish (2013)
film.summary: Jason Mewes and Kevin Smith sit around and talk in Ireland.
film.quote: As much as I like hearing Kevin Smith talk (the Evening With... dvds are fantastic), I just really wasn't into it. Maybe it's just the fact that while Mewes is funny, too much of him really just starts getting boring. I did laugh a few times, but I can't really recommend this one.

film.summary: A genetic anomaly allows a young man to teleport himself anywhere. He discovers this gift has existed for centuries and finds himself in a war that has been raging for thousands of years between "Jumpers" and those who have sworn to kill them. (imdb)

India in the new millennium is faced with corruption, unemployment, crime, and all-round insecurity. Many want to travel abroad to better their lives. Rashid Khan is an individual who assists them, albeit illegally, by taking huge amounts, and then transporting them to their choice of destinations... (imdb)

Cleveland Heep, a stuttering apartment superintendent, encounters a girl named Story swimming in the complex's pool. He soon learns that she comes from the Blue World, and has a message for mankind. Will he be able to help her complete her mission?
film.quote: At least M. Night tries. It tries to be an interesting fairy tale and while some of it is wonky, it's really not as offensive as people think. Yes, he kills a critic and yes, he put himself as the character whos writing will inspired the world. But the direction is solid like almost always and the script is pretty bad or at most, mediocre. That's what he does usually. But I liked the beginning part and a few parts. The acting had its ups and downs.

film.summary: The fate of mankind rests in the hands of one Lara Croft (Jolie), a twenty-first century heroine inspired by the most popular interactive video character in history. (Paramount Pictures)

A veteran D.C. journalist loses the thread of her own narrative when a guilt-propelled errand for her father thrusts her from byline to unwitting subject in the very story she's trying to break. Adapted from Joan Didion's namesake novel. (imdb)
film.quote: Just kinda boring, and that shouldn't be the case with this premise and the cast involved. I mean, Dafoe, Affleck and Hathaway and there's very little of note in the entire movie? Sure, Hathaway emotes when she has to and it's fine, but it never really hits the notes that it has to. The ending is a little sad, but that's about it. Mostly it's just a hard-to-follow plot that doesn't reveal much of interest when you do figure out what's going on.

film.summary: Four losers are thrust into the position of saving the world when they stumble upon a UFO crash site and become genetically equipped to the battle suit on board. (imdb)
film.quote: One critic called it &quot;the anti-Pixels&quot; but it's really only a few steps above the typical Adam Sandler trash. I like Rooster Teeth but this is NOT Red vs Blue any shape or form, except for the fact that they're both sci-fi comedies. A few gags worked, like with the stereotypical redneck Woody, but the laughs didn't come often. I had to wade through a lot of shit to find any gold nuggets. The special effects were totally competent though.

film.summary: Lillie runs a boarding house full of young bachelors. A friend writes to say she's sending her little darling daughter for a visit. The bachelors all buy toys for a little girl, but an attractive young woman gets off the train instead. (imdb)
film.quote: It's not really awful, it's just not worth seeing. What I learned from this film is that in 1909 it was okay to be a pedo. The real tragedy of the film is that the young, attractive woman has no idea how close she was to being in a really gross gangbang. But aren't we all clueless to that, really? I think so.

film.summary: A man wrongly convicted of conspiracy to commit espionage against the U.S. is offered his freedom if he can rescue the president's daughter from an outer space prison taken over by violent inmates. (imdb)
film.quote: I like Pearce and I believe him in this roll. The idea is just kind of stupid, why space? I like how it said "original story by Luc Besson." If you ignore John Carpenter maybe... but anyway, it just kind plodded along. It actually started off pretty promising but the action wasn't exciting and no characters were memorable. Escape from Space doesn't work.

film.summary: Young hero Thomas embarks on a mission to find a cure for a deadly disease known as the "Flare". (imdb)
film.quote: "Why are they hiding behind glass?" TheRealJ-Ro said that during the movie and I'm basing my review around it because it sums things up. The script is terrible with some illogical solutions to whatever problems they face and way too many moments where they are saved by people swooping in at the last minute. A little bit of that is expected in movies but not this much. Also, The Death Cure goes on far too long. It did not earn this runtime.

film.summary: Jason Statham stars as an experienced hit man who decides he's ready to retire his weapons once and for all -- after he finishes training eager young apprentice Steve McKenna (Ben Foster) in the ways of the professional kill. But the assassin's bosses are not pleased when they discover their man is giving away his trade secrets. Simon West directs and Donald Sutherland co-stars in this action-packed remake of the 1972 Charles Bronson thriller.
film.quote: Awful awful ending, it's so abrupt. They could have put an extra 10 minutes in between the two things that happen, something to make it seem to matter. Besides that, there are a couple good action scenes but nothing amazing. For it not doing anything that well, and for there being so many movies like this, you don't need to see it. It's not shitty enough to run away from it like it's a zombie, but it's also not good enough to recommend.

film.summary: A Jewish male nurse (Ben Stiller) plans to ask his live-in girl friend (Teri Polo) to marry him. However, he learns that her strict father (Robert DeNiro) expects to be asked for his daughter's hand before she can accept. Thus begins the visit from Hell as the two travel to meet Mom (Blythe Danner) and Dad, who turns out to be former CIA with a lie detector in the basement. Coincidentally, a sister (Nicole DeHuff) also has announced her wedding to a young doctor (Thomas McCarthy)... (imdb)
A poignant look at the many ways that the internet has changed the relationships between teenagers and their parents. (TIFF)
film.quote: A movie about the digital age that wants to say something incredible but can't. Same ol', the net doesn't connect us like it should. We text too much. Props to the actors who try and almost succeed in making you care a lil, but it fails as a drama and comedy. It's worst case scenario over and over for each character. I'd like to see a movie that says that we should still connect with IRL friends but that you can have a meaningful community online as well. But no, that would be too complicated.

film.filmname: Morgan and Destiny's Eleventeenth Date: The Zeppelin Zoo (2010)
film.summary: As Morgan and Destiny visit the Zeppelin Zoo for their eleventeenth date, they run into Lionel, Destiny's former boyfriend and a charming ladies' man. When Destiny's pet goes missing, Morgan and Lionel go head-to-head in search of the Destiny's pet and her affection. (imdb)
film.quote: Props for the visual style, can't at all get behind the narration, which uses big words all the time in an effort to seem smart. Speaking gigantic words really fast doesn't hide the fact that the plot is incredibly simplistic. It's a shame though, without the awful narration this could be decent at the very least.

film.summary: A mute bartender goes up against his city's gangsters in an effort to find out what happened to his missing partner. (imdb)
film.quote: Jones has been getting progressively worse, and this is coming from someone who actually enjoyed Warcraft as a dumb fantasy flick. I say this all the time but I love Rudd because he's one of the most charming actors out there, but he continues to pick a lot of crappy roles. When he's on screen this is relatively fun but aside from that it's just a rip-off of better sci-fi flicks, especially visually. Skarsgard is given nothing, and the script is terrible.

film.summary: A group of troublemakers are forced to attend night school in hope that they'll pass the GED exam to finish high school.
film.quote: There are a few laughs to be had. It has a painfully unfunny beginning but I thought it was going to turn a corner once it hit the night school because I actually laughed a few times during the initial encounters of the classmates. Yeah, not so. Some good jokes scattered very infrequently throughout and Haddish is a fun, sassy teacher, but even she becomes a little too much by the end.

film.summary: Based on the graphic novel, a police officer who can't be stopped by death returns to the streets time and time again to fight crime.
film.quote: I never would have checked this out if I wasn't curious to see what Crahan could do with a feature film. It's not even that it's terrible. I would have given this a passing grade because of how gleefully violent and silly it is, but what fails it is that the action sucks. Most of the time it's just Downe standing still and shooting people, with some painfully uninspired and boring camera work. It's stylish with lots of flashing everythings coming at you, and it is entertaining sometimes.

film.summary: A Christmas-themed special featuring characters from Walt Disney Pictures' 53rd full-length animated motion picture, &quot;Frozen (2013)&quot;. (imdb)
film.quote: It's not dreadful, but the main problem is I didn't see Frozen so I had no investment to these characters. To put this in front of Coco was weird to me just because while Frozen was popular, not everybody had seen it; normally it would be a fresh short, a nice bonus. It had a few decent laughs, a good message, good Pixar animation, whatever, but man that was ill advised. Also, IT WAS 21 MINUTES. After about 5 it was like, "Okay, time to move on."

film.summary: Robert Neville, due to an experimental vaccine, is the only survivor of an apocalyptic war waged with biological weapons.
film.quote: I wish I could like this. I like the premise, that's about it. I can enjoy cheese but this didn't do it for me, and some of the scenes were just so poorly done. The ending was awful. I wish I could have seen this back in 1971. Usually I can take into consideration that a movie is old and so I don't expect certain things, however, this movie is really dated. A good script is something that doesn't age, and this movie doesn't have it. I could have forgiven a lot had it had that one thing.

film.summary: A spoiled, wealthy yacht owner is thrown overboard and becomes the target of revenge from his mistreated employee. A remake of the 1987 comedy.
film.quote: Basically just kind of there, not bad enough to detest but not good enough to get a passing grade from me. I laughed a couple times and I enjoy Faris, but that's about all I can say. The rest wasn't always easy to get through.

film.summary: THE PARTY is a comedy wrapped around a tragedy. It starts as a celebration and ends with blood on the floor. (imdb)
film.quote: Clarkson's character annoyed me so much. She's a fine actress but the dialogue that spewed out of her mouth was infuriating, dull and tryhard. The Party might have gotten a little smile or two from me, but it wasn't funny, which would be fine if they were saying anything interesting. A chamber drama needs excellent writing and this lacked it, which is a shame because there's talent here and the actors are doing what they can with it. With that said, the ending was a nice kicker. Not recommended.

film.summary: On the day of their Father's 70th birthday party, four siblings come to terms with the publication of a novel written by the youngest sibling, that exposes the family's most intimate secrets...
film.quote: This was very by the books, but not a bad movie. It felt like a typical indie dramedy, where a family is fucked up, some 'quirky' things happen (in this case, porn shops and RAGING BONERS), and everyone eventually lets out how they feel at the end. It's depressing that it's so impressively average though, considering C. Hall is always a pleasure, Silverman is funny, Mara is gorgeous, and Greer has a charm about her. Talent doesn't lead to much here though. Again, not awful, just 'normal.'

film.summary: A tale about a family whose suburban home is invaded by angry spirits. When the terrifying apparitions escalate their attacks and take the youngest daughter, the family must come together to rescue her. (imdb)
film.quote: Upon a little more consideration, I dropped this from a 45 (which is close to recommending). It just wasn't that scary and when I think about it; isn't that the point? I give it some props for a little humour and some fun scenes. I wasn't bored, but the script needed major work.

film.summary: A scientist becomes obsessed with bringing back his family members who died in a traffic accident. (imdb)
film.quote: Keanu shows here that he's not always this awesome presence on the screen, to put it light. "Yes... you can have some PANcakes," for example. You could shit on the script which isn't clever and full of bad dialogue, but it really is the acting that does it in. And that atrocity starts about 5 or 10 minutes in (after an admittedly decent beginning that is tense and a little upsetting) once Keanu gets home. Never recovers from there, but at the very least it flirts with some ideas.

film.summary: The king of Rushmore prep school is put on academic probation. (imdb)
film.quote: I didn't like it. I don't know if it's just the mood I was in when I watched it but I could not get invested in it and didn't find it funny. I think I laughed once, I hardly smiled. The Anderson awkwardness/quirkiness didn't get me this time, which I think is something he risks whenever he makes a movie (at least from what I've seen).

film.summary: Strange occurrences plague a small town detective and his family as he investigates the disappearance of a young boy.
film.quote: I'm mad at the beginning when the kid is ripped from his bike because it makes no sense once everything is revealed. It's just a trick, not storytelling. Correct me if I'm wrong there. I was into this for the first act while viewing it, it was ominous and interesting, then they killed all suspense with annoying dinks taking over in the second act. The third act is pretty good though, I liked the twist at the very end. Very uneven movie. Not recommending this because again, fuck that beginning.

film.summary: Strange lights descend on the city of Los Angeles, drawing people outside like moths to a flame where an extraterrestrial force threatens to swallow the entire human population off the face of the Earth. (Universal Pictures)
film.quote: Theory: The character played by Zayas was taking anger management, it got cancelled because of aliens, and he was angry cuz of it... that's how I explain his needless aggression. Awful character. The rest of the movie was actually decent... the first half an hour/40 mins was good then it got a little wonky. That would have been forgiven if the ending wasn't one of the worst endings ever. You build up to that and you don't give me at least 15 minutes of CGI ass-kicking? You suck.
